monubilis: <entryFree id="n29638" type="main" key="mo^nu^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>moneo</etym>, <sense id="n29638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reminding, admonishing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <trans><tr>that serve as remembrancers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monumentalis: <entryFree id="n29639" type="main" key="mo^nu^menta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŭmentālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> [monumentum, <sense id="n29639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a monument, monumental</hi> (late Lat.): lapis, Auct. de Limit. p. 305 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
monumentarius: <entryFree id="n29640" type="main" key="mo^nu^menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŭmentārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a monument</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tomb</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ceraula,</quote> <trans><tr>who played at tombs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 342, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monumentum: <entryFree id="n29641" type="main" key="mo^nu^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŭmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭm-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> [moneo), <sense id="n29641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which preserves the remembrance of any thing, a memorial, a monument;</hi> esp. of buildings, statues, galleries, tombs erected to perpetuate the remembrance of a person or thing; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=139" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 139</bibl> Müll. </sense><sense id="n29641.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">statuam dare auream Solidam faciundam, quae siet factis monumentum suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monimenti causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:50:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 50, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumento ut esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcelli et Africani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">11: in Mamertino solo foederato atque pacato monumentum istius, crudelitatis constitutum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>, § 26: ego, quae monumenti ratio sit, nomine ipso admoneor, ad memoriam magis spectare debet posteritatis, quam ad praesentis temporis gratiam, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 32, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">placet mihi, legionis Martiae militibus monumentum fieri quam amplissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 41</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">plur. excellent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in monumentis majorum suorum sit interfectus (Clodius),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on the Via Appia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias monumentaque, quae ex fano Herculis collata erant,</quote> <trans><tr>memorials, votive offerings, images</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monimenta, quae in sepulcris: et ideo secundum viam, quo praetereuntes admoneant, et se fuisse, et illos esse mortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 45</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marii,</quote> <trans><tr>the temple built by him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the temple of Castor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:50:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 50, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs,</quote> <trans><tr>the house of Cicero, built by order of the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29641.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29641.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sepulchral monument, a sepulchre, tomb</hi> (syn.: sepulcrum, tumulus; class.): marmoreum, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without sepulcri: sepultus est in monumento avunculi sui,</quote> <trans><tr>family tomb, sepulchre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29641.4" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">written works, monuments</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">records</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exegi monumentum aere perennius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: monumenta rerum gestarum, <hi rend="ital">books of history, chronicles</hi>, Cic. <cb n="MORA" /> de Or. 1, 46, 201: <cit><quote lang="la">annalium,</quote> <trans><tr>the monuments of history</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commendare aliquid monumentis,</quote> <trans><tr>memoirs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber monumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,047:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Mal. 3, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29641.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a remembrancer, a mark, token</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">means of recognition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos monimentis commonefaciam bubulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29641.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">at illa laus est, magno in genere ... liberos hominem educare, generi monumentum et sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum laudis,</quote> <trans><tr>a memorial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 538</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monuste: <entryFree id="n29642" type="hapax" key="Monuste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Monustē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Danaides, who killed her husband Eurysthenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 170" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 170</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monychus: <entryFree id="n29643" type="main" key="Mo_ny^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mōnychus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mw/nuxos</foreign>, <sense id="n29643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 388</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 499</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mopsiani: <entryFree id="n29644" type="main" key="Mopsi^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsĭāni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the adherents of Mopsus, in the city of Compsa, during the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mopsium: <entryFree id="n29645" type="hapax" key="Mopsi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mo/yion</foreign>, <sense id="n29645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hill in Thessaly, between Tempe and Larissa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mopsopius: <entryFree id="n29646" type="main" key="Mopso^pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsŏpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*moyo/pios</foreign>, <sense id="n29646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mopsopia</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*moyopi/a</foreign>, an old name of Attica), <hi rend="ital">Mopsopian, Attic, Athenian</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Mopsopius juvenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Triptolemus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Athens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:423" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>Athens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 72</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsŏpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: Mopsopia tota, i. e. <hi rend="ital">all Athens</hi> or <hi rend="ital">all Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 121" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1276" default="NO">1276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mopsucrenae: <entryFree id="n29647" type="hapax" key="Mopsu_cre_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsūcrēnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mo/you krh=nai</foreign> (Mopsus-springs), <sense id="n29647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Cappadocia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mezanluk Khan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mopsuhestia: <entryFree id="n29648" type="hapax" key="Mopsuhesti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsuhestĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsuestĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mo/you e(sti/a</foreign> (Mopsus-hearth), <sense id="n29648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Cilicia, on the river Pyramus, near the sea, also called</hi> Mopsos; now <hi rend="ital">Missis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mopsus: <entryFree id="n29649" type="main" key="Mopsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mopsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mo/yos</foreign>. <sense id="n29649.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A soothsayer in Argos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 40, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29649.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A soothsayer in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 456</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:128" default="NO">128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:173" default="NO">173</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29649.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another soothsayer, the son of Manto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:207" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 207</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29649.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 26</bibl>; 29.—</sense><sense id="n29649.4" n="V" level="1"> Another name for Mopsuhestia, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mora: <entryFree id="n29650" type="main" key="mo^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. smar, remember; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">mer-, mar-; me/rmhra, me/rimna</foreign>, care; <foreign lang="greek">ma/rtur</foreign>, witness; cf. memor, memoria; perh. <foreign lang="greek">me/llein</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delay</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29650.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29650.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tarditas sententiarum, moraque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora et sustentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora aut tergiversatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram rei alicui inferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to delay, put off, defer, hinder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram ad insequendum intulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:64:section=165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 64, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere delectui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere dimicandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere creditoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>to put off payment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moras nectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:39:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahere,</quote> <trans><tr>to delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:888" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 888</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moliri,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">producere malo alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to defer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi moram dictis creas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">removere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make haste, not to delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram interponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to interpose delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: habeo paululum morae, dum, etc., Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar nihil in morā habuit, quominus perveniret,</quote> <trans><tr>delayed not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51, 2</bibl></cit>: saltus Castulonensis nequaquam tantā in morā est, <hi rend="ital">does not hinder</hi>, Asin. Pall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mora ulla est, quin eam uxorem ducam,</quote> <trans><tr>I will without delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so freq. in the poets: nec (haud) mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 82; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 717</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 548</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in morā illi sis,</quote> <trans><tr>hinder, keep waiting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me nulla est mora,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no delay on my part</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in me mora non erit ulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 5, 9</bibl>: nulla igitur mora per Novium ... quin, etc., <hi rend="ital">it is no fault of Novius</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si alia memorem, mora est,</quote> <trans><tr>it will detain us too long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: inter <pb n="1164" /> <cb n="MORA" /> moras consul mittit senatum, <hi rend="ital">in the meantime, meanwhile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter aliquas moras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>: sine mora, <hi rend="ital">without delay, at once</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego, ut debui, sine mora feci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Erut. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram certaminis hosti exemit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hastened it on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29650.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">a stopping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morae, respirationesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio non ictu magis quam morā imprimitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29650.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29650.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing that retards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delays, a hinderance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne morae illi sim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne morae meis nuptiis egomet siem (al. mora),</quote> <trans><tr>hinder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi morae est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">restituendae Romanis Capuae mora atque impedimentum es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Abas pugnae nodusque moraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricaeque moras et pectus perforat ingens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 485</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29650.6" n="B" level="2"> Mora temporis, <hi rend="ital">a space of time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an tibi notitiam mora temporis eripit horum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram temporis quaerere dum Hannibal in Africam traiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">temporaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29651" type="main" key="mo^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fish echeneis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 6</bibl> (al. remora).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29652" type="greek" key="mo^ra3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mo/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n29652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division of the Spartan army, consisting of three, five</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">seven hundred men</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram Lacedaemoniorum intercepit,</quote> <trans><tr>the Spartan army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 2, 3</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 37</bibl>, the best reading is agmen, v. Klotz ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
moracillum: <entryFree id="n29653" type="gloss" key="moracillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moracillum</orth>, <lbl>dim.</lbl> from moracius, Titin. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=139" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 139</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
moracius: <entryFree id="n29654" type="gloss" key="moraci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moracĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mora</etym>, <sense id="n29654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hard</hi>: nuces, Titin. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=139" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 139</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
moralis: <entryFree id="n29655" type="main" key="mo_ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mores</etym>, <sense id="n29655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to manners</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morals, moral</hi> (a word formed by Cicero; cf. moratus): quia pertinet ad mores, quos <foreign lang="greek">h)/qh</foreign> Graeci vocant, nos eam partem philosophiae de moribus appellare solemus. Sed decet augentem linguam Latinam nominare moralem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 1, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated by Seneca and Quintil.: philosophiae tres partes esse dixerunt, moralem, naturalem, et rationalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 10</bibl>: pars illa philosophiae <foreign lang="greek">h)qikh/</foreign> moralis est dicta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 19</bibl></cit> and 20: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a characteristic manner, characteristically</hi>, Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 2</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">morally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Apol. David. 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moralius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 1, 5.</sense></entryFree>
moralitas: <entryFree id="n29656" type="main" key="mo_ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moralis</etym>, <sense id="n29656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manner, characteristics, character</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">morality</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 3.</sense></entryFree>
moraliter: <entryFree id="n29657" type="main" key="mo_ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. moralis <sense id="n29657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
moramentum: <entryFree id="n29658" type="main" key="mo^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>moror</etym>, <sense id="n29658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which causes a delay, a hinderance</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 363, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moraria: <entryFree id="n29659" type="main" key="mo^ra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> statioron or chamaeleon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morate: <entryFree id="n29660" type="main" key="mo^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. moror <sense id="n29660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
moratim: <entryFree id="n29661" type="main" key="mo^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <etym>moror</etym>, <sense id="n29661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3, 1</bibl> dub. (al. memoratim).</sense></entryFree>
moratio: <entryFree id="n29662" type="main" key="mo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delaying, tarrying, a delay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morationibus impediri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litoraria,</quote> <trans><tr>delay on the coast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:5:74" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 5, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morator: <entryFree id="n29663" type="main" key="mo^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n29663.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A delayer, loiterer, malingerer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus publici commodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 10</bibl> (but moratorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47, 3</bibl>, and 24, 41, 5, is from morati; v. moror).—</sense><sense id="n29663.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A talker against time</hi>, a sort of advocate who spoke only to gain time while his principal rested and refreshed himself, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29663.2" n="III" level="1"> In the races, <hi rend="ital">persons who strove to embarrass and delay the runners, for the amusement of the crowd</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2597</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moratorius: <entryFree id="n29664" type="main" key="mo^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrātōrĭus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>morator</etym>, <sense id="n29664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delaying, dilatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cunctatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambages,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 31, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moratus: <entryFree id="n29665" type="main" key="mo^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from moror.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29666" type="main" key="mo_ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mos</etym>. <sense id="n29666.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mannered, of morals</hi>, good or bad; <hi rend="ital">constituted, conditioned, circumstanced</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nequiquam mulier exornata est bene, si morata est male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 132</bibl></cit>: condigne pater est ejus moratus moribus, id. <cb n="MORB" /> Capt. 1, 1, 39: <cit><quote lang="la">morata recte (puella),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri bene morati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hominum optime moratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita haec morata est janua,</quote> <trans><tr>is of such a nature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male moratus venter,</quote> <trans><tr>insatiable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene morata disciplina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut multitudinem melius moratam censeam fieri posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam bene morata civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene moratae urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29666.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. of style, etc., <hi rend="ital">adapted to the manners</hi> or <hi rend="ital">character</hi> of a person, or <hi rend="ital">to the subject, characteristic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte morata Fabula,</quote> <trans><tr>in which the characters are accurately drawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 319</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in oratione morata debent esse omnia cum dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morax: <entryFree id="n29667" type="hapax" key="mo^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>moror</etym>, <sense id="n29667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of delay, dilatory</hi>: cogitationes, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 451, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morbide: <entryFree id="n29668" type="hapax" key="morbi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morbĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. morbidus <sense id="n29668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
morbidus: <entryFree id="n29669" type="main" key="morbi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>morbus</etym>. <sense id="n29669.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sickly, diseased</hi> (rare and only ante-class. and post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. aeger, aegrotus): apes morbidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 26, 40, § 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29669.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sickly, unwholesome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1097" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1097</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1261</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morbifer: <entryFree id="n29670" type="main" key="morbi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morbĭfer</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">morbĭfĕrus</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>morbus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n29670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that brings disease</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">labes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 25, 238</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morbifico: <entryFree id="n29671" type="main" key="morbi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morbĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>morbus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n29671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to produce disease</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Salut. Praec. 19" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Salut. Praec. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morbonia: <entryFree id="n29672" type="main" key="Morbo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morbōnĭa</orth>, v. Morbovia.</entryFree>
morbositas: <entryFree id="n29673" type="hapax" key="morbo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morbōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>morbosus</etym>, <sense id="n29673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sickliness, unhealthiness</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si provincia, quam colimus, de morbositate suspecta est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit> (al. morbis aestate).</sense></entryFree>
morbosus: <entryFree id="n29674" type="main" key="morbo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>morbus</etym>, <sense id="n29674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sickly, ailing, diseased</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29674.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (only anteand post-class.): morbosum hominem morbo aliquo affectum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=139" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 139</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: equus, Labeo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl>; cf. ib. § 12.—</sense><sense id="n29674.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">diseased</hi> with lewdness, <hi rend="ital">consumed by unnatural passion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 57, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbosior omnibus cinaedis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 47</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">sick with longing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morbovia: <entryFree id="n29675" type="main" key="Morbo_vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morbōvĭa</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Morbōnĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>morbus</etym>, <sense id="n29675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the land of disease, sickdom</hi>, vulg. in execrations: <cit><quote lang="la">abire Morboviam jusserat,</quote> <trans><tr>go to the devil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morbus: <entryFree id="n29676" type="main" key="morbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. mar-, die; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">broto/s</foreign> (for <foreign lang="greek">mroto/s</foreign>), <foreign lang="greek">marai/nw</foreign>; cf. morior, marceo</etym>, <sense id="n29676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sickness, disease, disorder, distemper, ailment, illness, malady</hi>, of body or mind (class.). </sense><sense id="n29676.1" n="I" level="1"> Corporeal: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum appellant totius corporis corruptionem: aegrotationem morbum cum imbecillitate: vitium cum partes corporis inter se dissident: ex quo pravitas membrorum, distortio, deformitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 28</bibl></cit>: morbus est habitus cujusque corporis contra naturam, qui usum ejus facit deteriorem, Labeo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi aegrotationesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger morbo gravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morbo esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be sick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo affectum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis gravioribus morbis vitae jucunditas impeditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi valentes morbo tentari non possunt, corpora possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affligi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urgeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conflictari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morbum cadere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fall sick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delabi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum nancisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo consumi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Reg. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absumi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo aeger morbo gravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex morbo convalescere,</quote> <trans><tr>to recover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a morbo valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum depellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare,</quote> <trans><tr>to alleviate, relieve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplior fit,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes more violent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adgravescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingravescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitialis or major,</quote> <trans><tr>epilepsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regius,</quote> <trans><tr>the jaundice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: in morbo consumat, a form of imprecation, <hi rend="ital">may he spend it</hi> (the money) <hi rend="ital">in sickness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:39:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 39, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29676.2" n="II" level="1"> Mental. </sense><sense id="n29676.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Disease, a fault, vice</hi>, etc.: animi morbi sunt cupiditates immensae, <cb n="MORD" /> et inanes, divitiarum, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbum et insaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen insaniae significat mentis aegrotationem et morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic morbus qui est in re publicā, ingravescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si qui aegrotet, quo morbo Barrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima pars hominum morbo jactatur eodem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vultu morbum incessuque fatetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29676.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grief, sorrow, distress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod mulier facere incepit, nisi id efficere perpetrat, Id illi morbo, id illi senio est,</quote> <trans><tr>affliction, distress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">salvere me jubes, quoi tu abiens offers morbum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29676.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of trees, plants, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">infestantur namque et arbores morbis,</quote> <trans><tr>a disease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:116 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 116 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n29676.6" n="IV" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Morbus</orth>, <itype>personified as a deity</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Erebus and Nox</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 694" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 694</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 275</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 323</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mordacitas: <entryFree id="n29677" type="main" key="morda_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mordax</etym>, <sense id="n29677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the power of biting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stinging, mordacity</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">urticarum foliis inest aculeata mordacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 54, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinosa,</quote> <trans><tr>sharp, like sour wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 18, 72, § 120</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">snappishness, biting severity</hi> in language, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mordaciter: <entryFree id="n29678" type="main" key="morda_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mordax <sense id="n29678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mordax: <entryFree id="n29679" type="main" key="mordax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mordeo</etym>, <sense id="n29679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">biting, given to biting, snappish</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n29679.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: equus, Labeo ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: Memmius, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 240</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29679.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stinging, sharp, biting, pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urtica,</quote> <trans><tr>stinging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arista mordacior hordeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordacissima marga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 8, 4, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordaci icta ferro Pinus,</quote> <trans><tr>biting, deepcutting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <trans><tr>corrosive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 37, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel,</quote> <trans><tr>biting, sharp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:106" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <trans><tr>sharp, pungent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:86" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 50, § 89</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29679.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">biting, disposed to bite</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29679.4" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynicus,</quote> <trans><tr>biting, snarling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lividus et mordax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29679.5" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:563" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5</bibl></cit> prol. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">verum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:107" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudines,</quote> <trans><tr>biting, carking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belle interim subicitur pro eo, quod neges, aliud mordacius,</quote> <trans><tr>a more stinging assertion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 74</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mordācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">bitingly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postclass. prose), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim in nobis febris alias partes mordacius impellit, sed per omnia pari aequalitate discurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limā mordacius uti,</quote> <trans><tr>more sharply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mordeo: <entryFree id="n29680" type="main" key="morde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordĕo</orth>, <itype>mŏmordi</itype> (archaic memordi; <sense id="n29680.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <itype>morsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root smard-; Sanscr. mard-, bite; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">smerdno/s, smerdale/os</foreign>; (cf. Engl. smart)</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bite, to bite into</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29680.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: si me canis memorderit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 3</bibl> (Sat. v. 36 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">canes mordere possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordens pulex,</quote> <trans><tr>biting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:83" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(serpens) fixum hastile momordit,</quote> <trans><tr>bit into</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordeat ante aliquis quidquid, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:632" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 632</bibl></cit>: terram, <hi rend="ital">to bite the ground, bite the dust</hi>, of expiring warriors writhing on the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">procubuit moriens et humum semel ore momordit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 418</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 61</bibl>.—<mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsi a rabioso cane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laneaque aridulis haerebant morsa labellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 316</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29680.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to eat, devour, consume</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tunicatum cum sale mordens Caepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:30" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:305" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordes farris mordere canini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29680.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29680.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bite into, take fast hold of, catch fast; to press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut into</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">laterum juncturas fibula mordet,</quote> <trans><tr>takes hold of, clasps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordebat fibula vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod a lino mordetur,</quote> <trans><tr>where the thread presses in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus (corporis), qui mucronem (teli) momordit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor mordet humum,</quote> <trans><tr>takes hold of the ground, is rooted in the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:499" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 499</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of a river: non rura quae Liris quieta Mordet aqua, <hi rend="ital">cuts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">penetrates into</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29680.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To nip, bite, sting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutina parum cautos jam frigora mordent,</quote> <trans><tr>nips, attacks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: oleamque momorderit<pb n="1165" /> <cb n="MORE" />  aestus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordeat et tenerum fortior aura nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:14:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix gustu acri mordet,</quote> <trans><tr>bites, hurts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urtica foliis non mordentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>stinging, burning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14, 16, § 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29680.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bite, sting, pain, hurt</hi> (syn.: pungo, stimulo, remordeo; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): invidere omnes mihi, Mordere clanculum,</quote> <trans><tr>bit, stung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morderi dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocus mordens,</quote> <trans><tr>a biting jest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordear opprobriis falsis,</quote> <trans><tr>shall I be stung, vexed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par pari referto, quod eam mordeat,</quote> <trans><tr>to vex, mortify</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde me momorderunt epistolae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribis, morderi te interdum, quod non simul sis,</quote> <trans><tr>that it grieves you, affects you</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore occulto morderi,</quote> <trans><tr>to be attacked, tormented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec qui detrectat praesentia, Livor iniquo Ullum de nostris dente momordit opus,</quote> <trans><tr>detracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 124</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 14, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morderi conscientiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to feel the sting of conscience</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc mordebit objurgatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29680.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To seize fast, hold firmly</hi> in the mind (cf. mordicus, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tene, hoc morde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29680.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To squander, dissipate</hi>: de integro patrimonio meo centum milia nummūm memordi, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 9, 3</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 50 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
mordex: <entryFree id="n29681" type="main" key="mordex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mordeo</etym>, <sense id="n29681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">biting, gnawing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini mordices, v. l.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit> (better mordicus).—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mor-dex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the biter</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tooth</hi>, v. l. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140</bibl> (better mordicus, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
mordicatio: <entryFree id="n29682" type="main" key="mordi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mordico</etym>, <sense id="n29682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a griping</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventris mordicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:20:161" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 20, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:18:105" default="NO">2, 18, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mordicativus: <entryFree id="n29683" type="hapax" key="mordi^ca_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordĭcātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">biting, sharp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:144" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mordices: <entryFree id="n29684" type="main" key="mordi^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordĭces</orth>, v. mordicitus.</entryFree>
mordicitus: <entryFree id="n29685" type="main" key="mordi^ci^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordĭcĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>a lengthened form for 1. mordicus</etym>, <sense id="n29685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with the teeth</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">asini me mordicitus scindant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit> dub. (al. mordicibus, from obsol. mordex, <hi rend="ital">a bite;</hi> al. mordicus; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 30</bibl>, has mordicibus, where mordicitus is the more correct reading): <cit><quote lang="la">mordicitus appetens (al. mordicibus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mordico: <entryFree id="n29686" type="hapax" key="mordi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mordax</etym>, <sense id="n29686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bite, sting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est acerrimae atque mordicantis qualitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>biting, sharp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:8:34" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 8, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mordicus: <entryFree id="n29687" type="main" key="mordi^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordĭcus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>mordeo</etym>, <sense id="n29687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by biting, with bites, with the teeth</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o)da/c</foreign> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29687.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordicus arripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si adbites propius, os denasabit tibi Mordicus,</quote> <trans><tr>will bite your nose off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus eum mordicus interfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premere capita mordicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculam fortasse mordicus abstulisset,</quote> <trans><tr>would have bitten off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudā mordicus apprehensā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 55, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcibus feriens et mordicus appetens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 140</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: mordicus petere aurum e flammā expediat, e ceno cibum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29687.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem mordicus tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold fast to, not give up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba tenent mordicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:28:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 28, 78</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 184</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29688" type="hapax" key="mordi^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">biting, snappish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem equi mordici distraxerunt (al. mordicus, al. mordicibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mordosus: <entryFree id="n29689" type="gloss" key="mordo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mordōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">biting, given to biting</hi>: mordosus, <foreign lang="greek">dhktiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
more: <entryFree id="n29690" type="main" key="mo_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. morus <sense id="n29690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mores: <entryFree id="n29691" type="main" key="mo_re_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrēs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. mos.</entryFree>
moretarius: <entryFree id="n29692" type="main" key="mo^re_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrētārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>moretum</etym>, <sense id="n29692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the dish</hi> moretum (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">moretaria condimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrētārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dish</hi> moretum (made of garlic, rue, vinegar, oil, etc.), Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moretum: <entryFree id="n29693" type="main" key="mo^re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from same root with mordeo, q. v.</etym>. <sense id="n29693.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A country dish composed of garlic, rue, vinegar, oil</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:367" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 367</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29693.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a small poem ascribed to Virgil;</hi> v. Heyne and Sillig in Verg. Carm. vol. iv. p. 301 sq. Wagner (acc. to Stander in Zeitschr. für Alt. Wissensch. 1853, part 4, p. 289 sq., a <cb n="MORI" /> transl. of the <foreign lang="greek">*muttwto/s</foreign> of Virgil's Greek teacher Parthenius).</sense></entryFree>
morgentia: <entryFree id="n29694" type="main" key="Morgenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morgentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Murgan-.</entryFree>
morgetes: <entryFree id="n29695" type="main" key="Morge_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morgētes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mo/rghtes</foreign>, <sense id="n29695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people who anciently dwelt in Lucania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moribundus: <entryFree id="n29696" type="main" key="mo^ri^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>morior</etym>. <sense id="n29696.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dying</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">minus valet, moribundus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacentem moribundumque vidistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:39:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 39, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moribundus procubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:643" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <trans><tr>mortal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 732</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Soc. 4, p. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. 50, p. 306</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29696.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., causing death</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deadly, unwholesome</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">moribunda a sede Pisauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:81:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 81, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morigeratio: <entryFree id="n29697" type="main" key="mo_ri^ge^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrĭgĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>morigeror</etym>, <sense id="n29697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">compliance</hi> (ante-class.), Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 381 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
morigerator: <entryFree id="n29698" type="main" key="mo_ri^ge^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrĭgĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a complier</hi> (late Lat.), Sid.</sense></entryFree>
morigero: <entryFree id="n29699" type="main" key="mo_ri^ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrĭgĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. morigeror <sense id="n29699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
morigeror: <entryFree id="n29700" type="main" key="mo_ri^ge^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrĭgĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>morigerus</etym>, <sense id="n29700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to comply with, gratify, humor, endeavor to please</hi> (syn.: obsequor, obtempero; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): nunc si servitus evenit, ei vos morigerari mos bonus est,</quote> <trans><tr>to accommodate yourself to it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: voluptati aurium morigerari debet oratio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl>. —Esp., in mal. part., ore = fellare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl>.!*? <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrĭgĕro</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">dum mihi morigero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morigerus: <entryFree id="n29701" type="main" key="mo_ri^ge^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrĭgĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mos-gero</etym>, <sense id="n29701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">complying, obsequious, obedient</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meo me aequom est morigerum patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male morigerus mihi est danista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando una vivis meis morigera moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: dum me morigeram praebeo, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 433, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago ad omnem nutum hominis sui morigera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 14, p. 282, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 1 al.</bibl>—Esp., <hi rend="ital">compliant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1281</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
