morimarusa: <entryFree id="n29702" type="foreign" key="Morima^ru_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morimărūsa</orth> (Dead Sea), <sense id="n29702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Cimbric appellation of the North Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morini: <entryFree id="n29703" type="main" key="Mo^ri^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏrĭni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Belgic Gaul, near the channel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremique hominum Morini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 727</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morio: <entryFree id="n29704" type="main" key="mo_ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mwro/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arrant fool</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quidam tantae sunt fatuitatis, ut non multum a pecoribus differant: quos moriones vulgo vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 26" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:17:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 17, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:210" default="NO">14, 210</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n29704.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a monster, deformed person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:39:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 39, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29705" type="spur" key="mo^ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrĭon</orth>, <itype>a false reading for mormorion</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.</entryFree>
morion: <entryFree id="n29706" type="greek" key="mo_ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mw/rion</foreign>. <sense id="n29706.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A narcotic plant, nightshade, also called</hi> strychnus: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum genus (strychni), quod halicacabon vocant ... ab aliis morion, ab aliis moly appellatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 180</bibl></cit>.— —</sense><sense id="n29706.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The male mandrake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">album hoc (genus) alii arsena alii morion vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 94, § 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morior: <entryFree id="n29707" type="main" key="mo^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrĭor</orth>, <itype>mortŭus, 3</itype> (<sense id="n29707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut. part.</hi> moriturus, a, um, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:25:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 25, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 47, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 308</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 511</bibl> et saep.; old forms acc. to the fourth conj.: si vivimu' sive morīmur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 830</bibl> P.; Ann. v. 384 Vahl.; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> moriri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 124</bibl> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 215</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root mar-, die; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mor-</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">mro-, bro-</foreign>), <foreign lang="greek">mar; broto/s, marai/nw</foreign>; cf.: morbus, marceo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi> (cf.: pereo, intereo, occĭdo, occumbo, obeo, exspiro; class.). </sense><sense id="n29707.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: vivam an moriar, Enn. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. metus, p. 123 Müll. (Trag. v. 179 Vahl.): ego cum genui, tum morituros scivi, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 28</bibl> (Trag. v. 361 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque eundem (L. Tarquinium) ... accepimus mortuum esse, cum duodequadraginta regnavisset annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moriendum certe est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio,</quote> <trans><tr>of desire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fame senatores quinque morerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me esse homines mortuom dicant fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:7:8" default="NO">1, 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fame et siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: siti, id. <cb n="MORM" /> 4, 30, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10</bibl>; Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:232" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 232</bibl></cit>: ex vulnere, <hi rend="ital">of a wound</hi>, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:7:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 7, 33</bibl></cit> (6, 51): <cit><quote lang="la">fame,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inediā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 14, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significabat interruptis atque morientibus vocibus,</quote> <trans><tr>dying accents, the accents of a dying man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori videbamus in studio dimetiundi paene caeli atque terrae C. Galum,</quote> <trans><tr>spend his whole life in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te complexā morientem, Galle, puellā Vidimus,</quote> <trans><tr>desperately in love, dying for love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei mihi, si quis, Acrius ut moriar, venerit alter amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:1 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: moriar, si, <hi rend="ital">may I die, if</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 6, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29707.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to die away, decay, to wither away, pass away, to vanish, lose its strength</hi>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">of members of the body: id quod supra vinculum est, moritur,</quote> <trans><tr>loses its vitality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">rutam et hederas illico mori,</quote> <trans><tr>die away, perish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moriturque ad sibila campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:528" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 528</bibl></cit>.—Of fire: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas vidi nullo concutiente mori,</quote> <trans><tr>die out, go out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of comets: donec in exiguum moriens vanesceret ignem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta moriuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>lose their strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To end, close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies quidem jam ad umbilicum est dimidiatus mortuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—Comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">vae illis virgis miseris, quae hodie in tergo morientur meo,</quote> <trans><tr>will find their death, be destroyed, broken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut iste interpositus sermo deliciarum desidiaeque moreretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne suavissimi hominis memoria moreretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multa cotidie ab antiquis ficta moriantur,</quote> <trans><tr>fall into disuse, become obsolete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>. —Esp. (in eccl. Lat.), of the loss of moral or spiritual vitality, <hi rend="ital">to die, to lose virtue and divine guidance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Adam omnes moriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirma cetera quae moritura erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 7, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrtŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., dead</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29707.3" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n29707.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine tauri poto mortuus concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuum esse alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to be dead to one, to wish to have nothing further to do with him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29707.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29707.6" n="a" level="4"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">faint, overwhelmed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu, quod tibi succederetur, exsanguis et mortuus concidisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29707.7" n="b" level="4"> Of things concr. and abstr., <hi rend="ital">dead, decayed, withered, passed away</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et antiquae leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:18:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 18, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuā re verba nunc facis. Stultus es, rem actam agis,</quote> <trans><tr>dead, done with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29707.8" n="c" level="4"> Mare mortuum. </sense><sense id="n29707.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The North Sea</hi> of Europe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 94</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29707.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The Dead Sea</hi> of Judea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29707.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrtŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dead person, dead man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuum in domum inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a mortuis excitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to awake from the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 1, 57, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amandare aliquem infra mortuos,</quote> <trans><tr>even below the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut multis mortuus unus sufficeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa mortuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 27</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: mortuo verba facere, <hi rend="ital">to talk to a dead man</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 26</bibl>.—Esp. (eccl. Lat.), <hi rend="ital">dead, without spiritual life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen habes quod vivas et mortuus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides sine operibus mortua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jac. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eph. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 14</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi> to any thing, <hi rend="ital">not alive</hi> to it, <hi rend="ital">not open</hi> to its influence, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">peccato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">legi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui cum Christo ab elementis hujus mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Col. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui estis, et vita vestra est abscondita cum Christo in Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moritasgus: <entryFree id="n29708" type="main" key="Moritasgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moritasgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n29708.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A god of the Senones</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2028</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29708.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A male proper name among the Senones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moriturio: <entryFree id="n29709" type="main" key="mo^ri^tu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrĭtŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>4</itype>, <sense id="n29709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. desid</hi>. [morior], <hi rend="ital">to desire to die</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gramm. p. 2006" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gramm. p. 2006</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
mormorion: <entryFree id="n29710" type="main" key="mormorion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mormorion</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of darkbrown rock crystal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mormyr: <entryFree id="n29711" type="greek" key="mormyr"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mormyr</orth>, <itype>ȳris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mormu/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n29711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of fish in Pontus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictae mormyres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:110" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 110</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 152</bibl>. <pb n="1166" /> <cb n="MORO" /></sense></entryFree>
moro: <entryFree id="n29712" type="main" key="mo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. 1. moror <sense id="n29712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
morochites: <entryFree id="n29713" type="greek" key="mo^ro^chi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrŏchītes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mŏrŏchthos</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of a leek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morologus: <entryFree id="n29714" type="greek" key="mo_ro^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mwrolo/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n29714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking foolishly, foolish</hi> (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst., a fool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi morologus fio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moror: <entryFree id="n29715" type="main" key="mo^ror1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n29715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [mora]. </sense><sense id="n29715.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to delay, tarry, stay, wait, remain, linger, loiter</hi> (syn.: cesso, cunctor, haesito; class.); eamus ergo ad cenam: quid stas? <hi rend="ital">Thr.</hi> Ubi vis: <cit><quote lang="la">non moror,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I have no objection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucceius narravit, Brutum valde morari, non tergiversantem, sed exspectantem, si qui forte casus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid moror?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid multis moror?</quote> <trans><tr>why do I linger long? why make a long story of it?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne multis morer,</quote> <trans><tr>to be brief, in short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum morandum in his intervallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod adhuc Brundisii moratus es,</quote> <trans><tr>have tarried, remained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provinciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud multa moratus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without delaying long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec plura moratus,</quote> <trans><tr>without tarrying any longer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa quo locorum Sera moretur,</quote> <trans><tr>may linger, may be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corycia semper qui puppe moraris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:267" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 267</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi, et cum quibus moreris,</quote> <trans><tr>stay, reside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 32:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 32, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec morati sunt quin decurrerent ad castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 31, 8</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sexcentos moratorum in citeriore ripā cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 47, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 48, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad duo milia aut moratorum aut palantium per agros interfecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 41, 4</bibl></cit>; v. Drakenb. ad h. 1.—</sense><sense id="n29715.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to delay, retard, detain, cause to wait, hinder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne affinem morer, Quin, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum non morabor quin feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morari ac sustinere impetum hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conanti dexteram manum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 25, 41, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morari ab itinere proposito hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morantur pauci Ridiculum et fugientem ex urbe pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29715.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To fix the attention of, to delight, amuse, entertain</hi>: morata recte Fabula Valdius oblectat, populum meliusque moratur, Quam, etc., <hi rend="ital">delays</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">entertains</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 321</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina, quae possint oculos auresque morari Caesaris,</quote> <trans><tr>arrest</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardior stilus cogitationem moratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: profecto non plus biduum aut—<hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Aut? nihil moror, <hi rend="ital">I will wait no longer, will bear no delay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet convivas moror,</quote> <trans><tr>keep them waiting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29715.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: nihil morari aliquem, <hi rend="ital">not to detain a person, to let him go, to dismiss</hi>. Thus the consul said when he dismissed the Senate: <cit><quote lang="la">Nihil amplius vos moramur,</quote> <trans><tr>I will detain you no longer, you are dismissed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 10</bibl></cit>. This is the customary formula for abandoning an accusation and dismissing an accused person: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Sempronium nihil moror,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I withdraw my accusation against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se nihil morari magistrum equitum pronuntiasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negavit, se Gracchum morari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29715.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: nihil morari (with <case>acc.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quo minus</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to let a thing go</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not to value</hi> or <hi rend="ital">regard, to care nothing about it, to have nothing to say against it</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam vina nihil moror illius orae,</quote> <trans><tr>care nothing for it, am not fond of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dona moror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil ego istos moror faeceos mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clauses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieno uti nihil moror,</quote> <trans><tr>I do not want to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 16</bibl></cit>: nihil moror, eos salvos esse, et ire quo jubetis, <hi rend="ital">am not opposed to it, have nothing to say against it</hi>, Ant. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 17, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil moror eum tibi esse amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ego quidem moror, quominus decemviratu abeam,</quote> <trans><tr>I do not hesitate to, I will immediately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 54, 4</bibl></cit>. —Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., lingeringly, slowly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moratius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:14:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n29715.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏro</orth>, āre: quid moras? Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 395</bibl> P.: morares Enn. ib.: moraret, Pac. ib. (cf. <cb n="MORS" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 154, v. 11</bibl> Vahl.; Trag. Rel. p. 82 Rib.; Com. Rel. p. 16 ib.).—</sense><sense id="n29715.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: ita diu, ut plus biennium in his tricis moretur, <hi rend="ital">be spent, lost</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29716" type="main" key="mo_ror2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōror</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n29716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [<foreign lang="greek">mwro/s</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to be foolish, be a fool</hi> (post-Aug.), in the lusus verbb.: <cit><quote lang="la">morari eum (Claudium) inter homines desiisse, productā primā syllabā, jocabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morose: <entryFree id="n29717" type="main" key="mo_ro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. morosus <sense id="n29717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
morositas: <entryFree id="n29718" type="main" key="mo_ro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>morosus</etym>. <sense id="n29718.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Peevishness, fretfulness, moroseness</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si in morositatem inutilem et odiosam incidamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morositas et ea vitia, quae dixi, habent aliquid excusationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29718.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Niceness, pedantry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectatione et morositate nimiā obscurabat stilum,</quote> <trans><tr>over-scrupulousness, too great nicety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morosus: <entryFree id="n29719" type="main" key="mo_ro_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mos; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 54</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n29719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">peevish, fretful, wayward, capricious, captious, morose</hi> (syn.: tristis, severus, gravis, difficilis; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): usque eo difficiles ac morosi sumus, ut nobis non satisfaciat ipse Demosthenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at sunt morosi et anxii, et iracundi et difficiles senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canities,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>.—Of excessive care: <cit><quote lang="la">circa corporis curam morosior,</quote> <trans><tr>particular, fastidious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>.—Of things concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">cupressus natu morosa,</quote> <trans><tr>that grows with difficulty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>stubborn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelandi subtilitas,</quote> <trans><tr>anxious, painful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: si tibi morosa prurigine verminat auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrōsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n29719.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Peevishly, fretfully, captiously, morosely</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">morose ferre hominum ineptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29719.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Scrupulously, carefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram non morose legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 128</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium morosius ordinatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morosissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29720" type="main" key="mo^ro_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mora</etym>, <sense id="n29720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lingering, slow, slow in coming</hi> (lato Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cui morosum videtur quodcunque futurum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 34, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter fieri morosum quod ad celeritatem est inventum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Var. 1, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morpheus: <entryFree id="n29721" type="main" key="Morpheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morpheus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*morfeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Sleep and god of dreams</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excitat Morphea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 634</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">647</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morphnos: <entryFree id="n29722" type="greek" key="morphnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morphnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">morfno/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eagle that lives near lakes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morrenas: <entryFree id="n29723" type="gloss" key="Morrenas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morrenas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <sense id="n29723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. comm., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> Morrena or Morena (a country of Mysia), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 760, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mors: <entryFree id="n29724" type="main" key="mors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mors</orth>, <itype>tis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root mor, v. morior</etym> (<case>dat.</case> morte, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 24</bibl>), <sense id="n29724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">death</hi> in every form, natural or violent (syn.: letum, nex). </sense><sense id="n29724.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum mors est extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors ultima linea rerum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem sibi consciscere,</quote> <trans><tr>to kill one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:56:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 56, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obire,</quote> <trans><tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Plaut Aul. prol. 15: nam necessest me ... cras mortem exequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certae occumbere morti,</quote> <trans><tr>to submit to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad mortem dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to put to death, kill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem morte multare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">per vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte multatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte punire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morti addici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne humanum genus morte damnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius civium suorum vitae sedebat mortisque arbiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Polyb. 16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Polyb. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae et mortis habere potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illata per scelus,</quote> <trans><tr>assassination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem se offerre pro patriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 32</bibl></cit>: afferre, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multare aliquem usque ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: morte acerbissimā affici, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem duci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui legatio ipsa morti fuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>brought death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperfecta,</quote> <trans><tr>blindness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:582" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 582</bibl></cit>: morte suā mori, <hi rend="ital">to die a natural death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella res est, mori suā morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 69:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 69, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors suprema,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:416" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 416</bibl>: mortis fine, Boëth. Consol. 2, 7: quae <cb n="MORS" /> rapit ultima mors est, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 20</bibl>: proximus morti = moriens, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, 72</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">morti vicinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 306:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 306, 10</bibl></cit>; Hier. in Joel, 1, 13 al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui, mors cum appropinquet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus aetati mors propior erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adpropinquante morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:64 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30, 64 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut prorogetur tibi dies mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:17:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa mortis diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansurum est vitium usque ad diem mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 15 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors sola fatetur quantula sint hominum corpuscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:173" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 173</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortes, when several persons are spoken of: praeclarae mortes sunt imperatoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere mortes,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw away lives, to die in vain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc subitae mortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 144</bibl></cit>.—Also of different <hi rend="ital">forms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">modes of death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnīs per mortīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 854</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omni imagine mortium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 18, 2</bibl>.—Rarely of an abstract thing: <cit><quote lang="la">fere rerum omnium oblivio morsque memoriae,</quote> <trans><tr>death, total loss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29724.2" n="B" level="2"> Personified. </sense><sense id="n29724.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mors</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a goddess, the daughter of Erebus and Nox</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 197</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.—</sense><sense id="n29724.4" n="2" level="3"> (Eccl. Lat.) = eum qui habebat mortis imperium, id est, diabolum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 28, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ero mors tua, o mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hos. 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 6, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29724.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29724.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dead body, corpse</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): morte campos contegi, <hi rend="ital">with corpses</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem ejus (Clodii) lacerari,</quote> <trans><tr>body, corpse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 362</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis, quam juxta hominis mors laqueo pependerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 23, § 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:768" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 768</bibl>.—Hence, jestingly, of an old man: <cit><quote lang="la">odiosum est mortem amplexari,</quote> <trans><tr>a corpse, a skeleton</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29724.7" n="B" level="2"> Like <foreign lang="greek">fo/nos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the blood shed by murder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem multā morte recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 348</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29724.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which brings death</hi> (of missiles), <hi rend="ital">a deadly weapon</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mille cavet lapsas circum cava tempora mortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:792" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 792</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 517</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per pectora saevas Exceptat mortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:369" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 369</bibl></cit>.—Of a sentence or threat of death: <cit><quote lang="la">ut auferat a me mortem istam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ex. 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of terrible pangs and anxieties: contritiones mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">116, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a cruel and murderous officer: aderat mors terrorque sociorum et civium lictor Sestius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29724.9" n="D" level="2"> Esp. (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mors secunda,</quote> <trans><tr>the second death, future punishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors alone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Joh. 5, 16; also <hi rend="ital">spiritual death</hi>, that of a soul under the dominion of sin: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulus mortis peccatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 56</bibl></cit>; Rom. 8, 6 et saep.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
morsicatim: <entryFree id="n29725" type="main" key="morsi^ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morsĭcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>morsico</etym>, <sense id="n29725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by biting, by biting the lips together</hi> (ante-class.): labellis morsicatim lusitant, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morsicatio: <entryFree id="n29726" type="main" key="morsi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morsĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a biting</hi>: ciborum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=143:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 143, 1</bibl> Müll. (al. morsitatio).</sense></entryFree>
morsico: <entryFree id="n29727" type="main" key="morsi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morsĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mordeo</etym>. <sense id="n29727.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bite continually</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n29727.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bite, to press the lips together</hi> as in kissing (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ore improbo compulsat, et morsicat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 197, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limis et morsicantibus oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>winking, ogling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 119, 8 (al. morsito).</sense></entryFree>
morsiuncula: <entryFree id="n29728" type="main" key="morsi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morsĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. morsus</etym>, <sense id="n29728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bite; a biting with the lips, a kissing</hi> (ante- and post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">formicarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneris labellis molles morsiunculae,</quote> <trans><tr>kisses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morsum: <entryFree id="n29729" type="main" key="morsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mordeo</etym>, <sense id="n29729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bit, little piece</hi>, e. g. of wool (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">lanea morsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 316</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morsus: <entryFree id="n29730" type="main" key="morsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from mordeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29731" type="main" key="morsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">morsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mordeo</etym>, <sense id="n29731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a biting, a bite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29731.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: contra avium minorum morsus munitur vallo aristarum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:16:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsu apprehendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to bite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsibus insequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsu appetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tu mensarum morsus horresce futuros,</quote> <trans><tr>the eating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucida frusta farinae ... non admittentia morsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere morsus Exiguam in Cererem penuria adegit edendi,</quote> <trans><tr>their bites, their teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1167" /> <cb n="MORT" /> 112; so, <cit><quote lang="la">zonam morsu tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>by the teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:297" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 297</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29731.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29731.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A catching hold;</hi> and, concr., <hi rend="ital">that which takes hold, a catch</hi> (of a buckle, etc.; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quā fibulā morsus Loricae crebro laxata resolverat ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:624" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roboris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the cleft of the tree which held fast the javelin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:782" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 782</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulis agitatos morsibus ignes spirent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Falisc. 270</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29731.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sharpness of flavor, sharp taste, pungency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cibus ipse juvat morsu fraudatus aceti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:25:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marinus,</quote> <trans><tr>acrid quality</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et scabros nigrae morsu rubiginis enses,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a corroding, consuming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 243</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29731.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bite, sting, pain, vexation</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">(carmina) odio obscuro morsuque venenare,</quote> <trans><tr>a malicious attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetui curarum morsus,</quote> <trans><tr>gnawings, pains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <trans><tr>a bite, sting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis intermissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubiā morsus famae depellere pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:271" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 271</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morta: <entryFree id="n29732" type="main" key="Morta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*morth/</foreign>, <sense id="n29732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Fates</hi>, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 11</bibl>: tria sunt nomina Parcarum, Nona, Decima, Morta, Caesell. ib.</sense></entryFree>
mortalis: <entryFree id="n29733" type="main" key="morta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mors</etym>, <sense id="n29733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subject to death, liable to die, mortal</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29733.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in iis mortale et caducum, quid divinum aeternumque sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:23:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29733.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29733.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Human, mortal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucro,</quote> <trans><tr>of human workmanship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 740</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:97" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalin' decuit violari vulnere divum?</quote> <trans><tr>from the hand of a mortal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 797</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud tibi vultus Mortalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mortale sonans,</quote> <trans><tr>like a human voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mortalis idem nemo sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:76" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 76</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ipso homine mortalius,</quote> <trans><tr>more perishable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 110</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mortālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <hi rend="ital">comm., a man, mortal, human being</hi> (in <number>sing.</number> mostly ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lepidus ecastor mortalis est Strabax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol, mortalis malos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego, quantum mortalis deum possum, te ac tua vestigia sequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.—Usually <hi rend="ital">pīur.</hi>: mortales, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qnhtoi/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">mortals, men, mankind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad immortales attinet haec: deinceps quod ad mortales attinet, videamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 75</bibl></cit> Müll.: est locus Hesperiam quam mortales perhibebant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 23 Vahl.); cf.: omnes mortales sese laudarier optant, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Trin. 13:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Trin. 13, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 551 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes mortales hunc aiebant Calliclem vivere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu magnum inter mortales certamen fuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes mortales omnium generum, aetatum, ordinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendo multos mortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus debuisse fortunae, quam solus omnium mortalium in potestate habuit (Alexander),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 5, 35</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">mortālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">human affairs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29733.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Temporary, transient</hi> (opp. immortalis, imperishable, eternal; <cit><quote lang="la">v. immortalis): neque me vero paenitet, mortales inimicitias, sempiternas amicitias habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 6</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mortālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mortally, in the manner of mortals</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mortaliter vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enchir. 64" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enchir. 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mortalitas: <entryFree id="n29734" type="main" key="morta_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mortalis</etym>, <sense id="n29734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the state of being subject to death, mortality; a dying, death</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29734.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): omne, quod ortum sit, mortalitas consequitur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu meae mortalitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6 praef" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">2: mortalitatem explere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex mortalitate interceptus,</quote> <trans><tr>by death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mariti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">tofus aedificiis inutilis est mortalitate, mollitia,</quote> <trans><tr>perishableness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29734.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">mortals, mankind</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristem de mortalitate ferre sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra fortunam non satis cauta mortalitas est,</quote> <trans><tr>mankind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:7" default="NO">9, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:36 al" default="NO">10, 5, 36 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad erudiendam mortalitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 25, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mortaliter: <entryFree id="n29735" type="main" key="morta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mortalis <sense id="n29735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mortariolum: <entryFree id="n29736" type="main" key="morta_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortārĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mortarium</etym>, <sense id="n29736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small mortar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0923,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Aem. Mac.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mortarium: <entryFree id="n29737" type="main" key="morta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n29737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mortar</hi> (mostly <cb n="MORU" /> ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n29737.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortarium, in quo teruntur quae solvenda sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 543, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 41, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29737.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29737.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A large basin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trough in which mortar is made</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 177</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29737.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mortar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortario caementum addatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29737.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hollow resembling a mortar</hi>, dug round a tree: <cit><quote lang="la">arbori mortarium statim faciunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29737.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which is triturated in a mortar, a drug</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quae jam veteres sanant mortaria caecos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 170</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
morticinus: <entryFree id="n29738" type="main" key="morti^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mors</etym>, <sense id="n29738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dead, that has died</hi>, only of animals; hence, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an animal that has died of itself, carrion-;</hi> as a term of abuse, <hi rend="ital">carrion;</hi> and transf., <hi rend="ital">dead</hi> (ante-class. and postAug.). </sense><sense id="n29738.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">morticinae ovis carne vesci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres aut pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sacris ne morticinum quid adsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 7, § 84</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">soleae,</quote> <trans><tr>made from the hide of an animal that has died of itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morticine,</quote> <trans><tr>you carrion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭcīna</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">carcasses, carrion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29738.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: morticini clavi, <hi rend="ital">corns</hi> on the feet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 5</bibl></cit>: urnas reorum morticinas, i. e. sepulcra reorum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 384.</sense></entryFree>
mortifer: <entryFree id="n29739" type="main" key="morti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭfer</orth> <itype>or</itype> (rarely) <orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭfĕrus</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mors-fero</etym>, <sense id="n29739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">death-bringing, death-dealing, deadly, fatal</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: lethalis, funestus): poculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravior dolor nec tamen mortiferus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Aug. de Util. Cred. § 36: res mortifera est inimicus pumice levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:10" default="NO">10, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭfĕra</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">deadly things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur tam multa mortifera terra mortique (deus) disperserit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl></cit> (B. and K. pestifera).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭfĕrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mortally, fatally</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mortifere aegrotare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:36:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 36, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mortificatio: <entryFree id="n29740" type="main" key="morti^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mortifico</etym>, <sense id="n29740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a killing, death</hi> (eccl. Lat.), opp. vivificatio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mortifico: <entryFree id="n29741" type="main" key="morti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mortificus</etym>, <sense id="n29741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kill, destroy</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">caro mortificatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 37</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to mortify, subject, reduce to weakness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta carnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 8, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mortificus: <entryFree id="n29742" type="main" key="morti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mors - facio</etym>, <sense id="n29742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deadly, fatal</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: mortifico vulnere ictus, v. l. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl> (Halm).</sense></entryFree>
mortigena: <entryFree id="n29743" type="main" key="morti^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mors-gen-, gigno</etym>, <sense id="n29743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the producer of death, death-giver</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> p. 1163</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mortualia: <entryFree id="n29744" type="main" key="mortu^a_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortŭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mortuus</etym>. <sense id="n29744.0" n="I" level="1"> (Sc. vestimenta.) <hi rend="ital">Grave - clothes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mourningweeds</hi> (ante - class.), Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 548, 28</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 48 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n29744.1" n="II" level="1"> (Sc. carmina.)
