Haec sunt non nugae; non enim mortualia, <hi rend="ital">funeral songs, dirges</hi>, referring to the custom at Rome of hiring women to sing absurd eulogies of the dead at funerals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mortuarius: <entryFree id="n29745" type="main" key="mortu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the dead</hi> (ante-class.): mortuaria glossaria, <hi rend="ital">vocabularies of the dead</hi>, a term applied by Cato to the philosophers who talk of dead, and not of existing, things, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mortuosus: <entryFree id="n29746" type="main" key="mortu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">death-like, deadly</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:38" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29746.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Deadly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:10:71" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 10, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morturio: <entryFree id="n29747" type="main" key="mortu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>ire, 4</itype>, <sense id="n29747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. desid.</hi> [mors], <hi rend="ital">to long for death, desire to die</hi>: dictum est a Cicerone de philosophis, morturiunt, mori desiderant, Aug. de Gram. p: 2006 P. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:50:29, p. 146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. 50, 29, p. 146</bibl> B. and K.).</sense></entryFree>
mortuus: <entryFree id="n29748" type="main" key="mortu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mortŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. morior <sense id="n29748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
morula: <entryFree id="n29749" type="main" key="mo^ru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mora</etym>, <sense id="n29749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brief delay</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tempus nullā morulā extenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 11:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 11, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Fragm. M. 10, p. 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morulus: <entryFree id="n29750" type="main" key="mo_ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [2. morus], <hi rend="ital">black, dark-colored</hi> (ante-class): jam pol <cb n="MOS" /> ego illam pugnis totam faciam ut sit morula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morum: <entryFree id="n29751" type="greek" key="mo_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mw=ron</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">mo/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n29751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mulberry; a blackberry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigra mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 27, § 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in duris haerentia mora rubetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morus: <entryFree id="n29752" type="greek" key="mo_rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mwro/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foolish, silly</hi> (Plautin.). </sense><sense id="n29752.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor mores hominum moros et morosos facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc utimur more moro molestoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29752.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29752.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fool, simpleton</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29752.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a foolish woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 17</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">more hoc fit atque stulte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29753" type="greek" key="mo_rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mw=ra</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">more/a</foreign>, <sense id="n29753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mulberry-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor ibi, niveis uberrima pomis, Ardua morus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
morvinnicus: <entryFree id="n29754" type="main" key="Morvinni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Morvinnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Morvinnus</hi> (a town of the Ædui), Inscr. Giorn. Arcad. t. 28, p. 351.</sense></entryFree>
mos: <entryFree id="n29755" type="main" key="mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mos</orth>, <itype>mōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. root ma-, measure; cf.: maturus, matutinus; prop., a measuring or guiding rule of life; hence</etym>, <sense id="n29755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manner, custom, way, usage, practice, fashion, wont</hi>, as determined not by the laws, but by men's will and pleasure, <hi rend="ital">humor, self-will, caprice</hi> (class.; cf.: consuetudo, usus). </sense><sense id="n29755.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opsequens oboediensque'st mori atque imperiis patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huncine erat aequum ex illius more, an illum ex hujus vivere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: alieno more vivendum est mihi, <hi rend="ital">according to the will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">humor of another</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne fuit levius dominae pervincere mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: morem alicui gerere, <hi rend="ital">to do the will of a person, to humor, gratify, obey him</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic decet morem geras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo morem gessero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescenti morem gestum oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; v. gero.—</sense><sense id="n29755.2" n="II" level="1"> The will as a rule for action, <hi rend="ital">custom, usage, practice, wont, habit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges mori serviunt,</quote> <trans><tr>usage, custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi morique parendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibam forte Viā Sacrā, sicut meus est mos,</quote> <trans><tr>custom, wont</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra morem consuetudinemque civilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vero more agentur institutisque civilibus,</quote> <trans><tr>according to usage, according to custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos est hominum, ut nolint eundem pluribus rebus excellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mos est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:392" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 392</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">moris erat quondam servare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more sinistro,</quote> <trans><tr>by a perverted custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 87</bibl></cit>.— So with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morem traditum a patribus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc morem servare, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginibus Tyriis mos est gestare pharetram,</quote> <trans><tr>it is the custom, they are accustomed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui istic mos est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos ita rogandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mos fuit Bithyniae regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>: moris est, <hi rend="ital">it is the custom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negavit, moris esse Graecorum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 26</bibl></cit>, § 66; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:37:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 37, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae moris Graecorum non sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(aliquid) satis ex more Graecorum factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Domitiano moris erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quoque morum Tiberii erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter civium morem,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to custom, to usage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: sine more, <hi rend="ital">unwonted, unparalleled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus sine more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:238" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 238</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nullo more,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra morem: terra supra morem densa,</quote> <trans><tr>unusually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 227</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supra modum): perducere aliquid in morem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make into a custom, make customary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:162" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod jam in morem venerat, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>had become customary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 21, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29755.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in a moral point of view, <hi rend="ital">conduct, behavior;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">plur., manners, morals, character;</hi> in a good or bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">est ita temperatis moderatisque moribus, ut summa severitas summā cum humanitate jungatur,</quote> <trans><tr>manners</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavissimi mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, A, 6: boni, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 254, 8</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">corrumpunt mores bonos colloquia mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severi et pudici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: feri immanisque natura, Cic. Rosc. <pb n="1168" /> <cb n="MOST" /> Am. 13, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">totam vitam, naturam moresque alicujus cognoscere,</quote> <trans><tr>character</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 38:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos esse M'. Curii mores, eamque probitatem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Fam. 13:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:de Or. 2:43:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 182</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores disciplinamque alicujus imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Deiot. 10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Fam. 2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectura morum,</quote> <trans><tr>the supervision of the public morals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moribus et caelum patuit,</quote> <trans><tr>to good morals, virtue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 101: <cit><quote lang="la">amator meretricis mores sibi emit auro et purpurā,</quote> <trans><tr>polite behavior, complaisance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propitiis, si per mores nostros liceret, diis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>our evil way of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum quoque filius,</quote> <trans><tr>like his father in character</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne te ignarum fuisse dicas meorum morum, leno ego sum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>my trade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publicis moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29755.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29755.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Quality, nature, manner; mode, fashion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec meretrix fecit, ut mos est meretricius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores siderum,</quote> <trans><tr>qualities, properties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 56, § 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carneadeo more et modo disputare,</quote> <trans><tr>manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si humano modo, si usitato more peccāsset,</quote> <trans><tr>in the usual manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeco more bibere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apis Matinae More modoque,</quote> <trans><tr>after the manner of, like</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dardanius torrentis aquae vel turbinis atri More furens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more novalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli et anni mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, Praef. 23: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad morem actionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elabitur anguis in morem fluminis,</quote> <trans><tr>like</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hunc operis morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudum in morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morem vestis tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>mode, fashion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29755.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A precept, law, rule</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">moresque viris et moenia ponet,</quote> <trans><tr>precepts, laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 264</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis inponere morem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 852</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod moribus eorum interdici non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ferri duritiā pugnacius? sed cedit, et patitur mores,</quote> <trans><tr>submits to laws, obeys, is tamed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut leo mores Accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:2:183" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 2, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in morem tonsa coma, = ex more ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 556</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mosa: <entryFree id="n29756" type="main" key="Mo^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Belgic Gaul</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Meuse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Maas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moschi: <entryFree id="n29757" type="main" key="Moschi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moschi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people between the Black and the Caspian Seas</hi>, Mela, 1, 2, 5; 3, 5, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 29</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n29757.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Moschĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Moschian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 99</bibl>; Mela, 1, 19, 13.— </sense><sense id="n29757.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Moschus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Moschian</hi>, Mela, 1, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moschis: <entryFree id="n29758" type="gloss" key="Moschis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moschis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 318, 5</bibl>; Inscr. Mur. 477, 5.</sense></entryFree>
moschus: <entryFree id="n29759" type="main" key="Moschus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moschus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n29759.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorician of Pergamus, accused of poisoning</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29759.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 477, 5.</sense></entryFree>
moscilli: <entryFree id="n29760" type="hapax" key="moscilli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moscilli</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">moscŭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mos</etym>, <sense id="n29760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little customs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">usages</hi>: moscillis (al. mosculis) Cato pro parvis moribus dixit, Paul. ex Fest. pp. 158 and 159 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
mosella: <entryFree id="n29761" type="main" key="Mo^sella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏsella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Belgic Gaul</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Moselle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">largus Mosella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> de Clar. Urb. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placida Mosella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Idyll. 10, 73</bibl></cit>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏsŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏsellēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Moselle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moses: <entryFree id="n29762" type="main" key="Mo_ses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mōses</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mo[dibreve]ȳses</orth>, <itype>is or i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (in Vulg. <case>nom.</case> semper Mo[dibreve]ȳses; <sense id="n29762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Mo[dibreve]ȳsi, Lev. 8, 36; 16, 34; Num. 3, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">33, 1, etc.: Mosi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 274</bibl></cit>), = <foreign lang="greek">*mwsh=s, *mwush=s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Moses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Moses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Moyses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Moysen unum exsulum monuisse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Mose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successor fuit Mosi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarum videre Mŏysen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 3, 285</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 340</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n29762.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mōsēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Moses</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Moseia virga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 23, 354</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29762.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mō-sēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Moses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 219</bibl></cit> dub.—</sense><sense id="n29762.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mōsĭtĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Mosaic</hi>, Ven. Fort. Vit. St. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mostellaria: <entryFree id="n29763" type="main" key="Mostella_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mostellārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mostellum, <lbl>dim.</lbl> from monstrum</etym>, <sense id="n29763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Ghost</hi>, the name of <cb n="MOTU" /> a comedy of Plautus, also called Phasma (<foreign lang="greek">fa/sma</foreign>, ghost).</sense></entryFree>
mostellum: <entryFree id="n29764" type="main" key="mostellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mostellum</orth>, v. Mostellaria.</entryFree>
mosteni: <entryFree id="n29765" type="hapax" key="Moste_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mostēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Mostena <hi rend="ital">or</hi> Mostene, <hi rend="ital">a city of Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mosula: <entryFree id="n29766" type="main" key="Mo^su^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏsŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Mosella.</entryFree>
motabilis: <entryFree id="n29767" type="main" key="mo_ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>moto</etym>, <sense id="n29767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moving, that moves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
motacilla: <entryFree id="n29768" type="main" key="mo_ta^cilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtăcilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the white water-wagtail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">motacilla, quod semper movet caudam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 76</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 156</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 223</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
motarium: <entryFree id="n29769" type="main" key="mo_ta_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n29769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lint</hi> (post - class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8:134" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8, 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
motatio: <entryFree id="n29770" type="main" key="mo_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moto</etym>, <sense id="n29770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frequent motion, motion</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
motator: <entryFree id="n29771" type="main" key="mo_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mover</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motator sali Neptunus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
motio: <entryFree id="n29772" type="main" key="mo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moveo</etym>, <sense id="n29772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moving, motion; a removing</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29772.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">principium motionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ordine motio,</quote> <trans><tr>a removing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:20:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—Abstr., <hi rend="ital">motion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum animum ... quasi quamdam continuatam motionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29772.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in medicine, <hi rend="ital">an ague-fit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29772.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: motiones animi, <hi rend="ital">emotions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affections of the soul</hi> (old reading), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 8</bibl>; better, notionibus.</sense></entryFree>
motito: <entryFree id="n29773" type="main" key="mo_ti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>moto</etym>, <sense id="n29773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move often, move about</hi> (post - class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 6, 3</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
motiuncula: <entryFree id="n29774" type="main" key="mo_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>motio</etym>, <sense id="n29774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight motion, shaking;</hi> in medicine, <hi rend="ital">an attack of fever</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentatus in Campaniā motiunculis levibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 24 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
moto: <entryFree id="n29775" type="main" key="mo_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>moveo</etym>, <sense id="n29775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to keep moving, move about</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Zephyris motantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina quercūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 674</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta parietesque quati et motari videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:10" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
motor: <entryFree id="n29776" type="main" key="mo_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mover, that which keeps</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in motion</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">cunarum fueras motor, Charideme, mearum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hast rocked me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:39:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 39, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
motorius: <entryFree id="n29777" type="main" key="mo_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>motor</etym>, <sense id="n29777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moving, that has motion</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n29777.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: modus agendi, <hi rend="ital">a stirring, bustling, noisy style of playing</hi> (opp. statarius), Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 24</bibl>; id. ad argum. And.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 590</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n29777.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the power of motion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
motus: <entryFree id="n29778" type="main" key="mo_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. moveo <sense id="n29778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29779" type="main" key="mo_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>moveo</etym>, <sense id="n29779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a moving, motion</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n29779.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29779.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes, qui versantur contrario motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus motum dedit caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura omnia ciens et agitans motibus et mutationibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus astrorum ignoro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 42</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">futuri,</quote> <trans><tr>departure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub Aurorae primos excedere motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebri terrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>earthquakes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:2" default="NO">8, 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29779.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">artistic movement, gesticulation, dancing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud indecoros motus more Tusco dabant,</quote> <trans><tr>gesticulated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ionici,</quote> <trans><tr>dances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereri dare motūs,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform dances, dance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G 1, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestrici,</quote> <trans><tr>the motions of wrestlers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>. —Of the <hi rend="ital">gestures</hi> of an orator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 30, 116</bibl>.—Of military <hi rend="ital">movements, evolutions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad motūs concursūsque essent leviores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,011:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iph. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29779.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stage</hi> in the growth of a plant: <cit><quote lang="la">tres esse motūs in vite, seu potius in surculo, naturales: unum quo germinet: alterum quo floreat: tertium quo maturescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:28:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 28, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29779.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29779.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of the mind or heart, <hi rend="ital">a movement, operation, impulse, emotion, affection, passion, agitation, disturbance</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus, perturbatio): cum semper agitetur animus, nec principium motus habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motūs animorum duplices sunt, alteri cogitationis, alteri appetitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motūs animi nimii, i. e. perturbationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi motus et virtutis gloriam esse sempiternam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:68:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 68, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres quae dulcem motum afferunt sensibus,</quote> <trans><tr>sensation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: Manto, divino concita<cb n="MOVE" />  motu, <hi rend="ital">impulse, inspiration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 158</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29779.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29779.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A political movement, sudden rising, tumult, commotion</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29779.9" n="(a)" level="5"> In a good sense: Italiae magnificentissimus ille motus, Cic. pro Dom. 56, 142.—</sense><sense id="n29779.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Rebellion, sedition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Catilinae motūs conatūsque prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motum afferre rei publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servilis,</quote> <trans><tr>a rising of the slaves, insurrection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motum in re publicā non tantum impendere video, quantum tu aut vides, aut ad me consolandum affers,</quote> <trans><tr>a change, alteration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29779.11" n="2" level="3"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a trope</hi> (= immutatio verborum, Cic.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29779.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A motive</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">audisti consilii mei motūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
movens: <entryFree id="n29780" type="main" key="mo^vens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏvens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. moveo <sense id="n29780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
moveo: <entryFree id="n29781" type="main" key="mo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>mōvi, mōtum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n29781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sync.</hi>, mōstis for movistis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:67:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 67, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">mōrunt for moverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:141" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 141</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. mīv, set in motion; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)mei/bw</foreign>, change; cf.: momentum, mutare</etym>. </sense><sense id="n29781.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to move, stir, set in motion; to shake, disturb, remove</hi>, etc. (syn.: cieo, agito, ago, molior). </sense><sense id="n29781.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">movit et ad certos nescia membra modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut festis matrona moveri jussa diebus,</quote> <trans><tr>to dance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 232</bibl></cit>: moveri Cyclopa, <hi rend="ital">to represent a Cyclop by dancing</hi> (gesticulating), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fila sonantia movit,</quote> <trans><tr>struck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharam cum voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tympana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 48</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novis Helicona cantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0926,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> Astron. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum movere loco,</quote> <trans><tr>to move from the place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to go forward, advance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 420" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 420</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bestir one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">move ocius te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepit eis, ne se ex eo loco moverent,</quote> <trans><tr>not to stir from the spot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15</bibl>: castra, <hi rend="ital">to break up, remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die castra ex eo loco movent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ellipt. without castra: postquam ille Canusio moverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movisse a Samo Romanos audivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 28, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. reflex.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam hostes moverentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 19, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem statu,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive from his position, dislodge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem possessione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredes,</quote> <trans><tr>to eject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 19, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribu centurionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn out, expel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 272</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:43:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 43, 122</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same also without senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatorio loco,</quote> <trans><tr>to degrade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">move abs te moram,</quote> <trans><tr>remove, cast off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem de sententiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause to recede, to dissuade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteram,</quote> <trans><tr>to take away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 74</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis terras, omnia maria movere,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn the world upside down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29781.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To excite, occasion, cause, promote, produce; to begin, commence, undertake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatione sudor movetur,</quote> <trans><tr>is promoted, produced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletum populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 62, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui exspectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 33, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego istaec moveo, aut curo?</quote> <trans><tr>begin, commence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam pugna se moverat,</quote> <trans><tr>was going on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum decus,</quote> <trans><tr>begin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0926,001:1:42" default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> Astron. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis controversiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to begin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 25 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentionem rei,</quote> <trans><tr>to make mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:540" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere ac moliri aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to undertake any thing that excites disturbance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid moveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To shake, to cause to waver, to alter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus sententiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to change, cause to waver</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 42, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.6" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To present, offer</hi> an oblation: <cit><quote lang="la">ferctum Jovi moveto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.7" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To disturb, concern, trouble, torment</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">men moveat cimex Pantilius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniosne movet, Romana potentia cujus Sit ducis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 282</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:131" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 131</bibl>. intoleranda vis aestūs omnium ferme corpora movit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitu fora vestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:52" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.8" n="e" level="4"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si se gemmae nondum moveant,</quote> <trans><tr>do not yet appear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: de palmite gemma movetur,<pb n="1169" /> <cb n="MOX" />  <hi rend="ital">is produced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.9" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To exert, exercise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter principia condendi hujus operis, movisse numen ad indicandam tanti imperii molem traditur deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se movere, I. A. supra): artis opem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:760" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 760</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.10" n="g" level="4"> = mutare, <hi rend="ital">to change, transform</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum Forma semel mota est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil motum antiquo probabile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 54, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.11" n="h" level="4"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to move, affect, excite, inspire</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pulcritudo corporis movet oculos et delectat,</quote> <trans><tr>charms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me causae moverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fere fit, quibus quisque in locis miles inveteravit, uti multum earum regionum consuetudine moveatur,</quote> <trans><tr>is much affected, influenced</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>to stir up, excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movet feroci juveni animum conploratio sororis,</quote> <trans><tr>stirs his anger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 31, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina Dianae,</quote> <trans><tr>to irritate, provoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa movens animo,</quote> <trans><tr>to revolve, ponder, meditate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moverat plebem oratio consulis,</quote> <trans><tr>had stirred, made an impression on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutule moveri,</quote> <trans><tr>keenly affected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: neque illud me movet, quod, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16</bibl>, A. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveor etiam ipsius loci insolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil moveor lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:23:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 23, 25</bibl></cit> (4, 25, 5): <cit><quote lang="la">absiste moveri,</quote> <trans><tr>be not disturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos sectis Bellona lacertis Saeva movet,</quote> <trans><tr>inspires</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 565</bibl></cit> (al. monet): <cit><quote lang="la">ut captatori moveat fastidia,</quote> <trans><tr>excites nausea in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:202" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 202</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29781.13" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to move itself, move</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">terra dies duodequadraginta movit,</quote> <trans><tr>an earthquake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 40, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 59, 7</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reptile quod movetur,</quote> <trans><tr>which moves itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 26</bibl></cit> saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29781.14" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏvens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., movable</hi> (class.): ex eā praedā, quae rerum moventium sit, <hi rend="ital">movable things</hi> (as clothes, arms, furniture), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas,</quote> <trans><tr>that consists in motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtum rerum moventium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam quasi moventia,</quote> <trans><tr>motives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 68</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏventer</orth>, <hi rend="ital">movingly, affectingly</hi> (late Lat.), Schol. Bob. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7</bibl>, n. 4.—</sense><sense id="n29781.15" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., moved, affected, disturbed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Ithaci digressu mota Calypso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mox: <entryFree id="n29782" type="main" key="mox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mox</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. mankshu, ready, soon</etym>, <sense id="n29782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soon, anon, directly, presently;</hi> mostly of the future (class.). </sense><sense id="n29782.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29782.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">mox ivero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox ego huc revertor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussit mihi nuntiari, mox se venturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox tamen ardentīs accingar dicere pugnas Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: exspectant ... quam mox emittat currus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 89 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">exspecto quam mox utatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid exspectas quam mox ego dicam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expectabant quam mox comitia edicerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 37, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">provisam quam mox vir meus redeat domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam mox coctum est prandium?</quote> <trans><tr>how soon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox ubi,</quote> <trans><tr>as soon as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>: mox ut, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox ut caluere pugnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: mox quam, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29782.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29782.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Soon afterwards, thereupon, afterwards, then, in the next place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam extemplo fusi, fugati: mox intra vallum compulsi: postremo exuuntur castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:48:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 48, 6</bibl></cit>: primum ... deinde ... mox ... post ... <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29782.5" n="2" level="3"> Of a longer time, <hi rend="ital">afterwards, at a later period</hi> (post - Aug. for post, postea): <cit><quote lang="la">a quo mox principe Nero adoptatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hoc domūs pars videntur, mox reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo mox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 2, 3, § 5 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis mox horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 78, § 341</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29782.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">in the next place, then</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29782.7" n="A" level="2"> Of place and situation: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra eos Dochi, deinde Gymnetes, mox Anderae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 190</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars equitum ... mox prima legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29782.8" n="B" level="2"> Of value, esteem: <cit><quote lang="la">post amylum Chium maxime laudatur Creticum, mox Aegyptium,</quote> <trans><tr>then</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 17, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimum camelis, mox equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 237</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MUCR" /></sense></entryFree>
moyses: <entryFree id="n29783" type="main" key="Moyses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moyses</orth>, v. Moses.</entryFree>
moysiticus: <entryFree id="n29784" type="main" key="Mo^ysi_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏysītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Moyses</etym>, <sense id="n29784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Moses</hi> (post-class.), Venant. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mu: <entryFree id="n29785" type="greek" key="mu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mu</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu=</foreign>, a slight sound made with the closed lips (ante-class.): neque, ut aiunt, mu facere audent, <sense id="n29785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to mutter, make a muttering</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=101" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 101</bibl> Müll. (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 175</bibl>, n. 10 Vahl.): nec mu facere audet, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 213</bibl> P.: nec dico nec facio mu, Enn. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 25</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 175</bibl>, n. 8 Vahl.; but not in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 102</bibl>, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).—* </sense><sense id="n29785.1" n="II" level="1"> A sound of lamentation: mul perii hercle: Afer est, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 213</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
muccedo: <entryFree id="n29786" type="main" key="mucce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muccēdo, muccĭdus, muccĭnĭ-um, muccōsus, muccŭlentus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">muccus</orth>, v. mucedo, etc.</entryFree>
mucedo: <entryFree id="n29787" type="main" key="mu_ce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcēdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">muccēdo</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mucus</etym>, <sense id="n29787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mucus</hi> of the nose (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306</bibl> dub. (Hildebr. dulcedo).</sense></entryFree>
muceo: <entryFree id="n29788" type="main" key="mu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcĕo</orth>, <itype>ui, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be mouldy, musty</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vinum quod neque aceat, neque muceat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mucesco: <entryFree id="n29789" type="main" key="mu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n29789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [muceo], <hi rend="ital">to become mouldy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">musty</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">proprium est vino mucescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 26, § 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muchula: <entryFree id="n29790" type="main" key="muchula"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muchula</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Persian name of the precious stone</hi> telicardios, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 68, § 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mucia: <entryFree id="n29791" type="main" key="Mu_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Mucius.</entryFree>
mucianus: <entryFree id="n29792" type="main" key="Mu_ci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūcĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mut-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Mucius.</entryFree>
mucidus: <entryFree id="n29793" type="main" key="mu_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mucc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mucus</etym>. <sense id="n29793.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mouldy, musty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucida panis frusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29793.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Snivelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo es, Qui me emunxisti mucidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 3, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mucilago: <entryFree id="n29794" type="main" key="mu_ci^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcĭlāgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mucc-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>muceo</etym>, <sense id="n29794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mouldy, musty juice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mucinium: <entryFree id="n29795" type="main" key="mu_ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcĭnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mucc-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mucus</etym>, <sense id="n29795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pocket-handkerchief</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mucius: <entryFree id="n29796" type="main" key="Mu_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūcĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Mutius</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 13, 13</bibl>), <sense id="n29796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. The most celebrated are, </sense><sense id="n29796.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Mucius Scaevola, <hi rend="ital">who altempted to assassinate Porsena, and, on being apprehended, burned off his right hand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:66" default="NO">66</bibl>. 51; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:386" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 386</bibl>; Lact. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n29796.2" n="2" level="3"> Q. Mucius Scaevola, <hi rend="ital">a governor in Asia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caecil. 17, 57</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n29796.3" n="3" level="3"> Q. Mucius Scaevola, <hi rend="ital">an augur, the husband of Lælia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:211" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 58, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29796.4" n="4" level="3"> P. Mucius Scaevola, <hi rend="ital">a friend of the Gracchi, and an enemy of the younger Scipio Africanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:114" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 154</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūcĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Cn. Pompeius, afterwards divorced from him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 12, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29796.5" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Mucius, Mucian</hi>: Mucia prata trans Tiberim, dicta a Mucio, cui a populo data fuerant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n29796.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūcĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. festa), <hi rend="ital">a festival kept by the Asiatics in commemoration of the good government of</hi> Q.
