Mucius Scaevola, <hi rend="ital">the Mucius festival</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 51</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūcĭ-ānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mut-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Mucius, Mucian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:99" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satisdatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:104" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 104</bibl></cit>: exitus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the death of</hi> Q. Mucius Scaevola, <hi rend="ital">who was slain in the temple of Vesta by Damasippus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mucor: <entryFree id="n29797" type="main" key="mu_cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>muceo</etym>. <sense id="n29797.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mould, mouldiness</hi>, in bread (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mucorem contrahere,</quote> <trans><tr>to become mouldy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29797.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mustiness</hi>, in wine, vinegar, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mucor (vini),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a moisture</hi> which flows from vines, and is injurious to them: <cit><quote lang="la">mucor, qui maxime vites infestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 15, 25, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mucosus: <entryFree id="n29798" type="main" key="mu_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mucc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mucus</etym>, <sense id="n29798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slimy, mucous</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cruenta et mucosa ventris proluvies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:1" default="NO">6, 7, 1</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=158" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 158</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">exulceratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29798.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = stultus (opp. emunctae naris), Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mucro: <entryFree id="n29799" type="main" key="mucro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mucro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharp point</hi> or <hi rend="ital">edge;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">the point of a sword, the sword's point</hi> (class.; cf.: acies, cuspis). </sense><sense id="n29799.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucro falcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 3, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 16, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystalli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37</bibl></cit>, <cb n="MULA" /> 2, 9, § <cit><quote lang="la">26: cultri,</quote> <trans><tr>edge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:216" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio jugulaberis ensis,</quote> <trans><tr>sword's point</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coruscus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 333</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29799.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29799.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sword</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi mucrones militum tremere voltis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 740</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29799.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A point, extremity, end</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 520</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29799.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">edge, point, sharpness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censorii stili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunicius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 29, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <trans><tr>sharpness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mucronatus: <entryFree id="n29800" type="main" key="mu_cro_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcrōnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mucro</etym>, <sense id="n29800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointed</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">piscis mucronato rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muculentus: <entryFree id="n29801" type="main" key="mu_cu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mucc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mucus</etym>, <sense id="n29801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">snivelling</hi> (post-class.): nares, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 13, 282: <cit><quote lang="la">munctiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mucus: <entryFree id="n29802" type="main" key="mu_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mucc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mug, mungo; cf. also Sanscr. muć, solvere, dimittere</etym>, <sense id="n29802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">snivel, mucus</hi> of the nose: <cit><quote lang="la">mucusque, et mala pituita nasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mufrius: <entryFree id="n29803" type="main" key="mufrius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mufrius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a term of abuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mufrius non magister,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
muger: <entryFree id="n29804" type="gloss" key="muger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">muger</orth> <itype>dici solet a Castrensium hominibus, quasi mucosus, is, qui talis male ludit</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=158:27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 158, 27</bibl> Müll. (cf. Engl. smuggle; Germ. Schmuggel), a false player.</entryFree>
mugil: <entryFree id="n29805" type="main" key="mu_gil"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūgil</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūgĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">the mullet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugilum natura ridetur, in metu capite abscondito, totos se occultari credentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 26, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:144" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 42, 67, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:185" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 62, 88, § 185</bibl>; 10, 70, 89, § 193; <cit><quote lang="la">32, 11, 53, § 149.—This fish was made use of in punishing adulterers: quosdam moechos et mugilis intrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:317" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 317</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:15:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 15, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mugillanus: <entryFree id="n29806" type="main" key="Mugilla_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mugillānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> as, e. g. Papirius Mugillanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
muginor: <entryFree id="n29807" type="main" key="mu_gi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūgĭnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n29807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to dally, trifle, hesitate, delay</hi> (rare but class.): muginari est nugari et quasi tarde conari, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=147" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 147</bibl> Müll.: muginamur, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 139:7" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 139, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tu muginaris, cepi consilium domesticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—In the collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūsĭnor</orth>, āri: dum ista (ut ait M. Varro) musinamur. Plin. H. N. prooem. § 18.</sense></entryFree>
mugio: <entryFree id="n29808" type="main" key="mu_gi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūgĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root, muǵ, sonare; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">muka/omai, mu/zw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to low, bellow</hi> (syn. boo). </sense><sense id="n29808.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde cum actae boves mugissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic bove percusso mugire Agamemnona credit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:286" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 286</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pres. subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugientium Prospectat errantes greges,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cattle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:11" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29808.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the sound of a trumpet, <hi rend="ital">to bray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrhenusque tubae mugire per aethera clangor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 526</bibl></cit>.—Of an earthquake, <hi rend="ital">to rumble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pedibus mugire solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 256</bibl></cit>.—Of a mast: si mugiat Africis Malus procellis. <hi rend="ital">groans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 57</bibl>.—Of thunder, <hi rend="ital">to roar, crash, peal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugire tonitrua, rutilare fulgura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 5</bibl></cit>: quasi mugiente litterā M. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 31</bibl>: at tibi tergeminum mugiet ille sophos, <hi rend="ital">will bellow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out to you</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sofw=s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">well done! bravo!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:46:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 46, 8</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">to reject with a sound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruentum mugiit,</quote> <trans><tr>spat gore</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ruf. 1, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29809" type="gloss" key="Mugi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mugĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 339, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mugionia: <entryFree id="n29810" type="main" key="Mu_gi^o_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūgĭōnĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūgōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūgĭōnis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mucionis</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (porta), <sense id="n29810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gate of ancient Rome, which was afterwards within the city</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Palatio Mucionis a mugitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=164" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 164</bibl></cit> Müll.: Mugionia porta Romae dicta est a Mugio quodam. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 24</bibl>; cf. Becker's Antiq. 1, p. 109 sq.</sense></entryFree>
mugitor: <entryFree id="n29811" type="main" key="mu_gi_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūgītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. mugio</etym>, <sense id="n29811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bellower</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mugitor Vesuvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:208" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 208</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mugitus: <entryFree id="n29812" type="main" key="mu_gi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūgītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lowing, bellowing</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29812.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugitusque boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <trans><tr>to utter lowings, to low</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:560" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29812.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bellowing, rumbling, roaring, loud noise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugitus terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 86, § 360</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:263" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labyrinthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mula: <entryFree id="n29813" type="main" key="mu_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n29813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> mulabus: <cit><quote lang="la">data et vehicula cum mulabus ac mulionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Uxor. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 733</bibl> <pb n="1170" /> <cb n="MULC" /> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mulus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a she-mule;</hi> also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a mule</hi> (used instead of horses for drawing carriages or bearing litters): <cit><quote lang="la">ex asino et equā mula gignitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:181" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 181</bibl>.—She-mules bear no young, Plin. l. l. § <cit><quote lang="la">173. Hence: mulae partus a te prolatus est: res mirabilis propterea, quia non saepe fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:22:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 22, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc monstrum fetae conparo mulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 66</bibl></cit>.—Hence, prov.: cum mula peperit, <hi rend="ital">when a mule foals</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">never</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mularis: <entryFree id="n29814" type="main" key="mu_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mules</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">materies,</quote> <trans><tr>the race of mules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mulc: <entryFree id="n29815" type="main" key="mulc"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulc</orth>, <sense id="n29815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Persian name for the precious stone thelycardios</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 68, § 183</bibl>; al. muchala.</sense></entryFree>
mulcator: <entryFree id="n29816" type="main" key="mulca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mulco</etym>, <sense id="n29816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who handles roughly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 10, 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> Gloss. p. 483</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulcedo: <entryFree id="n29817" type="main" key="mulce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulcēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mulceo</etym>, <sense id="n29817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pleasantness, agreeableness</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris atque Musae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulceo: <entryFree id="n29818" type="main" key="mulce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulcĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum</itype> (rarely mulctum), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root marc, take hold of; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/rptw, ma/rptis</foreign>; cf. mulco</etym>, <sense id="n29818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stroke; to touch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">move lightly</hi> (syn. palpo; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n29818.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu mulcens barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:259" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulcebant Zephyri flores,</quote> <trans><tr>rustle through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura mulcet rosas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 60: <cit><quote lang="la">virgā mulcere capillos,</quote> <trans><tr>to touch lightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aristas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulcere alternos (pueros) et corpora fingere linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera pennis,</quote> <trans><tr>to move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 88</bibl></cit>: mulserat huc navem compulsam fluctibu' pontus, <hi rend="ital">had wafted hither</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 870</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 257 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n29818.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make sweet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula succis Lyaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:169" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 169</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29818.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to soothe, soften, appease, allay; to caress, flatter, delight</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">blandior. placo, lenio, sedo): mulcentem tigres, of Orpheus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:117:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 117, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To alleviate, mitigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">variā vulnera mulcet ope,</quote> <trans><tr>alleviates the pain of his wounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:401" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores nervorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 50, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os stomachumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebrietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 20, 81, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora fessa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 625</bibl></cit>: aliquem laudibus, <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi>, Pac. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Mulciber, p. 144 Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 109 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">puellas carmine,</quote> <trans><tr>to delight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos admiratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures figmentis verborum novis,</quote> <trans><tr>to delight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n29818.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj., mixed with honey; sweet as honey, honey-sweet</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulsa (sc. aqua),</quote> <trans><tr>honey-water, hydromel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <trans><tr>vinegar and honey mixed together, honey-vinegar</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 27, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulsa pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of words, etc., <hi rend="ital">sweet as honey, honeyed</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut mulsa dicta dicis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29818.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29818.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mulsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a term of endearment, <hi rend="ital">my sweetheart, my honey</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">age, mulsa mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29818.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mulsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">honey-wine, mead</hi>, i. e. wine mixed or made with honey (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">commisce mulsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceti, for mulsum acetum,</quote> <trans><tr>honeyvinegar</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 49, 714</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mulcetra: <entryFree id="n29819" type="hapax" key="mulce_tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulcētra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> heliotropium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulciber: <entryFree id="n29820" type="main" key="Mulci^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mulcĭber</orth>, <itype>ēris and ĕri</itype> (<sense id="n29820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> sync. Mulcebri, Cic. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> Tusc. 2, 10, 23), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mulceo; he who softens any thing; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Vulcan</hi>: Mulciber, Vulcanus, a molliendo scilicet ferro dictus: mulcere enim mollire, sive lenire est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=144" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 144</bibl> Müll.; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 558 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">Mulciber, credo, arma fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 562</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mulciber in Trojam, pro Troia stabat Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VOLCANO MITI SIVE MVLCIBERO L. VETT.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1382</bibl></cit>: VOLCANO MVLOIBERO SACR., Inscr. Rein. cl. 1, n. 265. —</sense><sense id="n29820.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 263</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 533</bibl>; Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 23; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 576</bibl>. <cb n="MULI" /></sense></entryFree>
mulco: <entryFree id="n29821" type="main" key="mulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulco</orth> (‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">mulcto</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 155, 1</bibl>), āvi, ātum, 1 (mulcassitis, for mulcaveritis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 8</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root marc, take hold of; of. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/rptw</foreign>, perh. <foreign lang="greek">morfh/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat, cudgel; to maltreat, handle roughly, injure</hi> (class.; syn.: verbero, tundo, pulso). </sense><sense id="n29821.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum dominum atque omnem famibam Mulcavit usque ad mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ad 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:134" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to illtreat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male mulcati clavis ac fustibus repelluntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulcato corpore,</quote> <trans><tr>with bodies bruised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prostratos verberibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 32</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <trans><tr>to injure, damage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 30, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29821.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptores illos male mulcatos, exisse cum Galbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 88</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 8</bibl>, mulcaverim is undoubtedly corrupt, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
mulcta: <entryFree id="n29822" type="main" key="mulcta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulcta, mulctātĭcĭus, mulctā-tĭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mulcto</orth>, v. multa, etc.</entryFree>
mulctra: <entryFree id="n29823" type="main" key="mulctra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulctra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n29823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a milkingpail, milk-pail</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29823.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis venit ad mulctram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e mulctrā recens caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. mulctrum.—</sense><sense id="n29823.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the milk in a milk-pail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl>; cf. mulctrum.</sense></entryFree>
mulctrale: <entryFree id="n29824" type="main" key="mulctra_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulctrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. mulctrarium.</entryFree>
mulctrarium: <entryFree id="n29825" type="main" key="mulctra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulctrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (coll. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mulc-trāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 3, 30</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n29825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a milking-pail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivea implebunt mulctraria vaccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 177</bibl></cit> Wagn. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (Rib. mulctraria; al. multraria, al. mulgaria).</sense></entryFree>
mulctrum: <entryFree id="n29826" type="main" key="mulctrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulctrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a milking-pail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic injussae veniunt ad mulctra capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:145" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:66" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 33</bibl>; 9, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. mulctra.</sense></entryFree>
mulctus: <entryFree id="n29827" type="main" key="mulctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (only in <sense id="n29827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>) [id.], <hi rend="ital">a milking</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulgare: <entryFree id="n29828" type="main" key="mulga_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulgāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n29828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a milkingpail</hi>: tepidi mulgaria lactis, Valg. ap. Serv and Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulgeo: <entryFree id="n29829" type="main" key="mulge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulgĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum or ctum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr marǵ, wipe or rub away; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)-me/lgw</foreign>; Germ. melken; Engl. milk</etym>, <sense id="n29829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to milk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 39, 56, § 115</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulgent ad caseum faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulgere hircos, of something impossible,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mulicurius: <entryFree id="n29830" type="gloss" key="mu_licuri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlicurĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>v. hibrid. from mulus-<foreign lang="greek">koureu/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mule-clipper</hi>: mulicurius, <foreign lang="greek">h(miono/kouros</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
muliebris: <entryFree id="n29831" type="main" key="mu^li^e^bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕbris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mulier</etym>, <sense id="n29831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a woman, womanly, female, feminine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29831.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loci muliebres, ubi nascendi initia consistunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen, i. e. de mulieribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna Muliebris, worshipped in memory of the wife and mother of Coriolanus, who persuaded him to retreat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29831.2" n="B" level="2"> In a reproachful sense, <hi rend="ital">womanish, effeminate, unmanly</hi>: parce muliebri supellectili. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Quae ea est supellex? <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Clarus clamor sine modo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:26 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 26 sq.</bibl>: animum geritis muliebrem, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 227 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris enervataque sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—Gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">feminine</hi> (opp. virilis): <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=40 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 40 sq.</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n29831.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕbrĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n29831.4" n="A" level="2"> = pu denda muliebria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebria pati,</quote> <trans><tr>to let one's self be used as a woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29831.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Womanish things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebria cetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit> = menstrua: <cit><quote lang="la">desierant Sarae fieri muliebria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 18, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕ-brĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n29831.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In the manner of a woman, like a woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec muliebriter Expavit ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingemiscens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hunni equis muliebriter insidentes,</quote> <trans><tr>in the manner of women</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29831.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Womanishly, effeminately</hi>: si se lamentis muliebriter lacrimisque dedet. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid serviliter muliebriterve faciamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antinăum suum muliebriter flere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 14, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
muliebritas: <entryFree id="n29832" type="main" key="mu^li^e_^bri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭē^brĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>muliebris</etym>, <sense id="n29832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">womanhood</hi> opp. to virginity (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 14</bibl>. <cb n="MULL" /></sense></entryFree>
muliebriter: <entryFree id="n29833" type="main" key="mu^li^e_^bri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭē^brĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. muliebris <sense id="n29833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
muliebrosus: <entryFree id="n29834" type="main" key="mu^li^e_^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭē^brōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mulier</etym>, <sense id="n29834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of women</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus muliebrosum (al. mulierosum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mulier: <entryFree id="n29835" type="main" key="mu^li^er"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭer</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mollior, <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> of mollis, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n29835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman, a female</hi>, whether married or not. </sense><sense id="n29835.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29835.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres omnes propter infirmitatem consilii, majores in tutorum potestate esse voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a virgin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres omnes dicuntur, quaecumque sexūs feminini sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil non permittit mulier sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:457" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 457</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29835.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a wife</hi>, opp. to a maid: <cit><quote lang="la">ecqua virgo sit aut mulier digna, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero objurgantibus, quod sexagenarius Publiliam virginem duxisset, "cras mulier erit" inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si virgo fuit primo, postea mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17, 8 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudica mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:39" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>; Inscr Orell. 4661.—</sense><sense id="n29835.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">a woman</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a coward, poltroon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non me arbitratur militem, sed mulierem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mulierarius: <entryFree id="n29836" type="main" key="mu^li^e^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mulier</etym>, <sense id="n29836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a woman</hi> (mostly postclass.). </sense><sense id="n29836.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: manus, <hi rend="ital">the band sent by Clodia</hi>, Cic Cael. 28, 66: voluptas, Auct. ap. Trebell. Trig. Tyrann. 6, 7.—</sense><sense id="n29836.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lover of women</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 5</bibl> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">al munerarios),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Albin. 11, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 10, 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
muliercula: <entryFree id="n29837" type="main" key="mu^li^ercu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭercŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little woman, mere woman, girl</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui illo susurro delectari se dicebat aquam ferentis mulierculae,</quote> <trans><tr>a common working girl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl>; Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">num suas secum mulierculas sunt in castra ducturi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierculam Vincere mollitie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 23</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">pantheris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=100" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 100</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
muliercularius: <entryFree id="n29838" type="main" key="mu^li^ercu_la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭercūlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>muliercula</etym>, <sense id="n29838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lover of women</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 3, 16, 1.</sense></entryFree>
mulieritas: <entryFree id="n29839" type="main" key="mu^li^e^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mulier</etym>, <sense id="n29839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">womanhood</hi>, opp. to maidenhood (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 12</bibl> (al. muliebritas).</sense></entryFree>
muliero: <entryFree id="n29840" type="main" key="mu^li^e^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make womanish, render effeminate</hi> (ante-class.): Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 140, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulierositas: <entryFree id="n29841" type="greek" key="mu^li^e^ro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mulierosus</etym>, <sense id="n29841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fondness for women</hi>, as a transl. of the Gr <foreign lang="greek">filogu/neia</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulierosus: <entryFree id="n29842" type="main" key="mu^li^e^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŭlĭĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mulier</etym>, <sense id="n29842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of women</hi> (class.): homo, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 28, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl>; v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 24</bibl> (v. muliebrosus).</sense></entryFree>
mulinus: <entryFree id="n29843" type="main" key="mu_li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mulus</etym>, <sense id="n29843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mule</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor, i. e. stolidum, fatuum (al. Mutinensis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mulio: <entryFree id="n29844" type="main" key="mu_li^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mule-keeper, a mule-driver, muleteer; a mule-dealer, mule-hirer</hi> (mostly ante-class. and postAug.). </sense><sense id="n29844.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=159" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 159</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulionesque cum cassidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>; Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:317" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 317</bibl>.—A sobriquet applied to Vespasian, because his necessities had obliged him to make money by trading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>.—Prov.: infantior quam meus est mulio, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 56, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29844.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of gnat</hi>, an enemy to bees, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29845" type="main" key="Mu_li^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mūlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 339, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulionicus: <entryFree id="n29846" type="main" key="mu_li^o_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlĭōnĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. mulio</etym>, <sense id="n29846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a muledriver</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulioniam paenulam arripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">tectus cuculione mulionico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 32, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mulleolus: <entryFree id="n29847" type="main" key="mulle^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mullĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [mulleus], <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">calceus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
mulleus: <entryFree id="n29848" type="main" key="mulle^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mullĕus calcĕus</orth>, <itype>or</itype>, <sense id="n29848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mul-lĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mullus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a reddish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">purplecolored shoe</hi>, worn only by the three highest magistrates (the consul, prætor, and curule ædile): mulleos genus calceorum aiunt esse; quibus reges Albanorum primi, deinde patricii sunt usi, quos putant a mullando dictos, i. e. suendo, Paul. ex Fest. <pb n="1171" /> <cb n="MULT" /> p. 142 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen his (mullis) Fenestella a colore mulleorum calciamentorum datum putat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mullo: <entryFree id="n29849" type="gloss" key="mullo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mullo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n29849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to sew;</hi> v. mulleus.</sense></entryFree>
mullulus: <entryFree id="n29850" type="main" key="mullu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mullŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mullus</etym>, <sense id="n29850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little red mullet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">barbel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbatulos mullulos exceptans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit> dub. (Orell., mullos).</sense></entryFree>
mullus: <entryFree id="n29851" type="main" key="mullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish highly esteemed, the red mullet, barbel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulli barbati in piscinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 27</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
mulocisiarius: <entryFree id="n29852" type="gloss" key="mu_lo^ci^si^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlŏcĭsĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mulus- cisium</etym>, <sense id="n29852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who rides in a carriage drawn by mules</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">karouxa/rios</foreign>, mulocisiarius, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
mulomedicina: <entryFree id="n29853" type="main" key="mu_lo^me^di^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlŏmĕdĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mulus-medicina</etym>, <sense id="n29853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of curing the diseases of mules</hi>, Veg. Vet. praef. 1 and 2.</sense></entryFree>
mulomedicus: <entryFree id="n29854" type="main" key="mu_lome^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mūlomĕdĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mulus-medicus</etym>, <sense id="n29854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mule-doctor</hi>, Veg. Vet. praef. 1; Firm. Math. 8, 13; Edict. Diocl. 7, 20.</sense></entryFree>
mulsa: <entryFree id="n29855" type="main" key="mulsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. <itype>mulceo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. 1.</entryFree>
mulseus: <entryFree id="n29856" type="main" key="mulse^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulsĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mulsum, v. mulceo</etym>, <sense id="n29856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetened with honey; sweet as honey</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mulsea aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>honey-water, hydromel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 75, § 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquor mulsei saporis,</quote> <trans><tr>sweet as honey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 45, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mulsum: <entryFree id="n29857" type="main" key="mulsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>mulceo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B. 2.</entryFree>
mulsura: <entryFree id="n29858" type="hapax" key="mulsu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulsūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mulgeo</etym>, <sense id="n29858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a milking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:34" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mulsus: <entryFree id="n29859" type="main" key="mulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. mulceo <sense id="n29859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
multa: <entryFree id="n29860" type="main" key="multa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mulcta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Sabine, acc. to Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 5</bibl>; Oscan, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=142" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 142</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n29860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a penalty</hi> involving loss of property, <hi rend="ital">a fine, amercement, mulct;</hi> in the most ancient times riches consisted only in the possession of flocks and herds; it accordingly signified, at first, <hi rend="ital">a fine in cattle;</hi> but in later times, when money was the measure of wealth, it signified <hi rend="ital">a pecuniary fine</hi> (whereas poena denotes a punishment of any kind, e. g. corporal punishment, imprisonment, capital punishment): <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum ipsum multae M. Varro non Latinum, sed Sabinum esse dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: multam Osce dici putant poenam quidam. M. Varro ait poenam esse, sed pecuniariam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=142" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 142</bibl> Mull.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pecore diceretur multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=95" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 95</bibl></cit> Müll. The highest penalty in the earliest times was thirty head of cattle, the lowest a sheep, in specifying which the word ovis is used as of the masculine gender: ego ei unum ovem multam dico, <hi rend="ital">I condemn him to pay, fine him</hi>, a legal formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae dictio ovium et bovium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.—Later, of a <hi rend="ital">pecuniary fine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa praesens quingentum milium aeris in singulas civitates imposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam alicui dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>to decree, award</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:289" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committere,</quote> <trans><tr>to deserve, incur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=177" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 177</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrogare (of the plaintiff, or people's tribune),</quote> <trans><tr>to propose that the accused be fined a certain sum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 36</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 33, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem multā et poenā multare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam alicui facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: certare, <hi rend="ital">to contend on both sides whether or not the proposed fine should be paid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo tribuni plebis ducentum milium aeris multam M. Postumio dixerunt: cui certandae cum dies advenisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae certatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:8:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa erat Veneri,</quote> <trans><tr>for the benefit of Venus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 9, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa gravis praedibus Valerianis,</quote> <trans><tr>a heavy loss, great damage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29860.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a penalty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulos jure jurando adigam non aliter quam stantes cibum capturos esse ... hanc multam feretis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ei multa esto: vino viginti dies Ut careat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n29861" type="main" key="multa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multa</orth>, <sense id="n29861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. fem.</hi>, v. multus.</sense></entryFree>
multangulus: <entryFree id="n29862" type="main" key="multangu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multangŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">multiang-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n29862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having many angles, multangular</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 654</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multanimis: <entryFree id="n29863" type="gloss" key="multa^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-animus</etym>, <sense id="n29863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having much spirit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">courage, spirited, courageous</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Frat. Arv. p. 690. <cb n="MULT" /></sense></entryFree>
multannus: <entryFree id="n29864" type="gloss" key="multannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multannus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multusannus</etym>, <sense id="n29864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of many years, ancient</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">poluxro/nios</foreign>, multannus, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
multaticius: <entryFree id="n29865" type="main" key="multa_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multātīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mulct-</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. multa</etym>, <sense id="n29865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fines, fine-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>fine-money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 39, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 6, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multaticus: <entryFree id="n29866" type="gloss" key="multa_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multātĭcus</orth>, <itype>or, archaic</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ moltā-tĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to fines, fine-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVAISTORES AIRE MOLTATICOD DEDERONT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 469, 2</bibl></cit>: AEDILES AERE MVLTATICO, Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 263, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multatio: <entryFree id="n29867" type="main" key="multa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mulct-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. multo</etym>, <sense id="n29867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a penalty, amercement, fine</hi> in any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">misera est multatio bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multatio non nisi ovium boumque impendio dicebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AEDILIS MVLTATIO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2488</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multatitius: <entryFree id="n29868" type="main" key="multa_ti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multātītĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mulct-</orth>), v. multaticius.</entryFree>
multesimus: <entryFree id="n29869" type="hapax" key="multe_si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multēsĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus</etym>, <sense id="n29869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">multesimal</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very small, trifling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 651</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 136, 39</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
multiangulum: <entryFree id="n29870" type="main" key="multi^angu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭangŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>multus-angulus</etym>, <sense id="n29870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a polygon</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/gwnon</foreign>, Boëth. de Arithm. 2, 24; cf. multangulus.</sense></entryFree>
multibarbus: <entryFree id="n29871" type="spur" key="multi^barbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭbarbus</orth>, <itype>false reading for illutibarbus</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 341, 29</bibl>.</entryFree>
multibibus: <entryFree id="n29872" type="main" key="multi^bi^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭbĭbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-bibo</etym>, <sense id="n29872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much-drinking</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multicaulis: <entryFree id="n29873" type="main" key="multi^caulis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-caulis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-caulis</etym>, <sense id="n29873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-stalked</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multicavatus: <entryFree id="n29874" type="main" key="multi^ca^va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-căvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multuscavatus</etym>, <sense id="n29874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with many hollows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cavities, multicavous</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">favus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multicavus: <entryFree id="n29875" type="hapax" key="multi^ca^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-căvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multuscavus</etym>, <sense id="n29875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-holed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 561</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multicius: <entryFree id="n29876" type="main" key="multi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., soft, splendid, transparent</hi>, a term applied to garments (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n29876.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: dabis Aureliano tunicas multicias viriles decem (al. multilicias), Valerian. Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">synthesis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Pall. 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29876.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">multīcĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, sc. vestimenta, <hi rend="ital">soft, splendid, transparent garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:76" default="NO">76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:186" default="NO">11, 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multicola: <entryFree id="n29877" type="hapax" key="multi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>multus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n29877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a many-worshipper, one who worships many</hi>, Fulg. adv. Arianos.</sense></entryFree>
multicolor: <entryFree id="n29878" type="main" key="multi^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-color</etym>, <sense id="n29878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-colored</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n29878.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hexecontalithos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 60, § 167</bibl></cit>: Iris, App. de Mundo, p. 64, 18.—</sense><sense id="n29878.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭcŏlor</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a many-colored garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multicolorus: <entryFree id="n29879" type="main" key="multi^co^lo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭcŏlōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manycolored</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti multijuga dicimus, et multicolora et multiformia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 104</bibl></cit>; App. de Mundo, 16.</sense></entryFree>
multicomus: <entryFree id="n29880" type="main" key="multi^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multuscoma</etym>, <sense id="n29880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having much hair</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); transf. of radiant light, <hi rend="ital">abounding in rays</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 418</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multicupidus: <entryFree id="n29881" type="main" key="multi^cu^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-cŭpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multuscupidus</etym>, <sense id="n29881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much-desiring, that desires much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">many things</hi> (ante-class.): juvenilitas, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 123, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multifacio: <entryFree id="n29882" type="main" key="multi^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, for magnifacio, <sense id="n29882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make much of, to esteem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">value highly</hi> (ante-class.): multifacere dicitur, sicut magnifacere, parvifacere. Cato: Neque fidem, neque jusjurandum, neque pudicitiam multifacit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=152" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 152</bibl> Müll. (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 50</bibl>, the correct read. is multi fecit).</sense></entryFree>
multifariam: <entryFree id="n29883" type="main" key="multi^fa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭfārĭam</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭfārĭē</orth>, <sense id="n29883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. multifarius <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
