multifarius: <entryFree id="n29884" type="main" key="multi^fa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭfārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus</etym>, <sense id="n29884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manifold, various, multifarious</hi> (the <pos>adj.</pos> post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">militares coronae multifariae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n29884.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭfārĭam</orth> (<case>acc.</case> form), <hi rend="ital">on many sides, in many places</hi> (class.): multifariam dixerunt antiqui, quod videlicet in multis locis fari poterat, id est dici, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=142" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 142</bibl> Müll.: sancius multifariam factus, <hi rend="ital">in many places</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 19</bibl>: multifariam defossum aurum, Cic. de <cb n="MULT" /> Or. 2, 41, 174: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie multifariam nulla (ju dicia) sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:Leg. 1:14:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castris visae togae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 31, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 8, 4</bibl> Drak. and Fabri <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 33, 18, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 41, 8: nasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29884.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭfārĭē</orth> (post - Aug.), <hi rend="ital">in many ways, variously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem est Ortygia, quae multifarie traditur: nunc Asteria ... nunc Lagia, vel Cynetho: Pyrpile etiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> Gloss. p. 482</bibl> Mai. (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 54</bibl>, where Sillig and others read multifarie in the sense of multifariam, Jan. and Detlefsen read multifariam).</sense></entryFree>
multifer: <entryFree id="n29885" type="main" key="multi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-fer</orth>, féra, <itype>fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multusfero</etym>, <sense id="n29885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing much, fruitful</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 11, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:138" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 41, § 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multifidus: <entryFree id="n29886" type="main" key="multi^fi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭfĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-findo</etym>, <sense id="n29886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-cleft</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divided into many parts</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n29886.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 259</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 644</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a comb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:25:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 25, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29886.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the hair, <hi rend="ital">many-parted, parted into many locks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi multifidos crinis sinuatur in orbes, Idaliā divisus acu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of rivers, <hi rend="ital">divided into many streams</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timavus,</quote> <trans><tr>many-armed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29886.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror,</quote> <trans><tr>various, manifold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:661" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaticinandi scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multiflorus: <entryFree id="n29887" type="main" key="multi^flo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭflōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-flos</etym>, <sense id="n29887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in flowers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 9, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multifluus: <entryFree id="n29888" type="main" key="multiflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multiflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n29888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing copiously</hi>, trop. of speech (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 586</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multiforabilis: <entryFree id="n29889" type="main" key="multi^fo^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-fŏrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-forabilis</etym>, <sense id="n29889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-holed, perforated with many holes</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tibiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multiforatilis: <entryFree id="n29890" type="main" key="multi^fo^ra_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-fŏrātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-foro</etym>, <sense id="n29890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many - holed, perforated with many holes</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 341 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multiforis: <entryFree id="n29891" type="main" key="multi^fo^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-fŏris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus - foris</etym>, <sense id="n29891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-doored, having many entrances, openings</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">holes</hi> (post - Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 218</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multiformis: <entryFree id="n29892" type="main" key="multi^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-formis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-forma</etym>, <sense id="n29892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-shaped, multiform; various, diverse, manifold</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiformes sumus,</quote> <trans><tr>have a fickle character</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes multiformes et variae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varius, multiplex, multiformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 14:6" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ennius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Verr. 1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Verr. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mul-tĭformĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in many ways, variously</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">varie et multiformiter disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:5:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 69, § 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multiformitas: <entryFree id="n29893" type="main" key="multi^formi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭformĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">multiformity</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ver. Relig. 21" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ver. Relig. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multiforus: <entryFree id="n29894" type="main" key="multi^fo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-fŏrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-foris</etym>, <sense id="n29894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having many openings, pierced with many holes</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">non illos ... multifori delectat tibia buxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 346" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 346</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multifructus: <entryFree id="n29895" type="main" key="multifructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multifructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multusfructus</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">polu/karpos</foreign>, <sense id="n29895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in fruit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 2</bibl>; Mythogr. Lat. 2, 130.</sense></entryFree>
multigeneris: <entryFree id="n29896" type="main" key="multi^ge^ne^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-gĕnĕris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-genus</etym>, <sense id="n29896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of many kinds</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">multis et multigeneribus opus est tibi Militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta multigenerum multa, for multorum generum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multigenerus: <entryFree id="n29897" type="main" key="multi^ge^ne^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭgĕnĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. multigenus.</entryFree>
multigenus: <entryFree id="n29898" type="main" key="multi^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-gĕnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-gĕnĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-genus</etym>, <sense id="n29898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of many kinds, various</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multigenis variata figuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa haec et multigenera terrestrium volucrumque vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multigrumus: <entryFree id="n29899" type="main" key="multi^gru_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-grūmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multusgrumus</etym>, <sense id="n29899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much heaped up;</hi> of waters, <hi rend="ital">greatly swollen</hi> (ante class.): fluctus, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multijugus: <entryFree id="n29900" type="main" key="multi^ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-jŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-jŭ-gis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (the latter form only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ait. 14, 9</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus - jugum</etym>, <sense id="n29900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yoked many together</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n29900.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multijugi equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrigae multijugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29900.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">many, manifold, complex, various</hi>: litterae multijuges, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia multijuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multijuga et sinuosa quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina (Aristotelis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 297 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> <pb n="1172" /> <cb n="MULT" /></sense></entryFree>
multilaudus: <entryFree id="n29901" type="hapax" key="multi^laudus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-laudus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multuslaus</etym>, <sense id="n29901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much-praised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir (al. aemulandus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multilicius: <entryFree id="n29902" type="main" key="multi^li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭlīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-licium</etym>, <sense id="n29902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of many threads</hi>: tunica, Valerian ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> 12</bibl> (al. multicia).</sense></entryFree>
multiloquax: <entryFree id="n29903" type="hapax" key="multi^lo^quax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-lŏquax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multusloquax</etym>, <sense id="n29903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that talks much, talkative, loquacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiloquaces mulieres (al. multumloquaces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multiloquium: <entryFree id="n29904" type="main" key="multi^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-lŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>multus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n29904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a much-speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 31</bibl>; Ambros. de Job, 1, 6, 20; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Psa. 1, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multiloquus: <entryFree id="n29905" type="main" key="multi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-lŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talkative, loquacious</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">coquus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit tacitus, qui naturā fuerat multiloquus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multimammia: <entryFree id="n29906" type="main" key="Multi^mammi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Multĭmammĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>multus-mamma</etym>, <sense id="n29906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the many-breasted</hi>, an epithet of the Ephesian Diana, who was represented with many breasts: Dianam, Hier. Ep. ad Ephes. prooem.</sense></entryFree>
multimeter: <entryFree id="n29907" type="main" key="multi^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-mĕter</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>multus - metrum</etym>, <sense id="n29907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many - metred, consisting of many feet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kinds of verse</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si poëmata illius metiaris, multimeter, argutus, artifex erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multimodis: <entryFree id="n29908" type="main" key="multi^mo^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-mŏdis</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from multi' modis for multis modis</etym>, <sense id="n29908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in many ways</hi> or <hi rend="ital">modes, variously</hi> (very rare, and rejected by Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 82</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc etsi multimodis reprehendi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 82</bibl></cit> B. and K.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sive vocalibus saepe brevitatis causā contrahebant, ut ita dicerent, multi modis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multimodis sapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multimodis injurius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 4, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina multimodis immixta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:895" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 895</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de cujus morte multimodis apud plerosque scriptum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multimodus: <entryFree id="n29909" type="main" key="multi^mo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-mŏdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multusmodus</etym>, <sense id="n29909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manifold, various</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coitio potestatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Dogm. Plat. p. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambages,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 10, p. 253 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (but very dub. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 3, 4</bibl>, where the correct read. seems to be multifariam; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Fabri ad h. l.): tela, Amm 24, 2, 13: vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 17 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allapsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multinodus: <entryFree id="n29910" type="main" key="multi^no_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-nōdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-nōdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus - nodus</etym>, <sense id="n29910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having many knots</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multinodis voluminibus serpens coluber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 166, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagellis multinodi genere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anfractus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 423</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253</bibl>, the correct read. is multimodas).</sense></entryFree>
multinominis: <entryFree id="n29911" type="main" key="multi^no_mi^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-nōmĭnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-nomen</etym>, <sense id="n29911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-named</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multinubentia: <entryFree id="n29912" type="main" key="multi^nu_benti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-nūbentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>multus-nubo</etym>, <sense id="n29912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marrying several persons, polygamy</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">multinubentiae pronus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multinubus: <entryFree id="n29913" type="main" key="multi^nu_bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-nūbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">married to several, polygamous</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Salomon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 123, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multinummus: <entryFree id="n29914" type="main" key="multi^nummus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-nummus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">multĭnūmus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-nummus</etym>, <sense id="n29914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that costs much money, dear, expensive</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">asini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: piscis, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 3, 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multipartitus: <entryFree id="n29915" type="main" key="multi^parti_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-partītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multuspartitus</etym>, <sense id="n29915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much divided, divided into many classes</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multipeda: <entryFree id="n29916" type="main" key="multi^pe^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭpĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>multus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n29916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a multipede</hi>, an insect, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 58, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:143" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 39, § 143</bibl>; v. millepeda.—</sense><sense id="n29916.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A measure</hi> a number of feet long, Gram. Vet. p. 190, 6.</sense></entryFree>
multipes: <entryFree id="n29917" type="main" key="multi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-footed, multipede</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n29917.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 102, § 249</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29917.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a multipede, millipede</hi>, an insect: <cit><quote lang="la">multipes vermis terrenus a multitudine pedum vocatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multiplex: <entryFree id="n29918" type="main" key="multi^plex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-plex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-* plica</etym> (multīplex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:208" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 208</bibl>; <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> multiplica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 16</bibl>), <sense id="n29918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has many folds</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29918.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus est multiplex et tortuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29918.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29918.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That has many windings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealed places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis serpens multiplici lapsu et erratico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>the labyrinth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29918.4" n="B" level="2"> In implied comparisons,<cb n="MULT" />  <hi rend="ital">manifold, many times as great, far more</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id efficiebat multiplex gaudium rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplex caedes utrimque facta traditur ab aliis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>far greater than I state it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 64, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29918.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That has many parts, manifold, many, numerous, various</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 55, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Extensive, large, wide, spacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 523" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerumna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestates verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 54, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplices variique sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3</bibl></cit>: large multiplici constructae sunt dape mensae, <hi rend="ital">of many courses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dishes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 304</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplex et tortuosum ingenium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inconstant, changeable. fickle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir multiplex in virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:105:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 105, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>dexterous, sly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplex avis,</quote> <trans><tr>rich in ancestors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:543" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 543</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭplĭcĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in manifold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">various ways</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multipliciter fatigari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. 2</bibl></cit> ad Caes.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varie et multipliciter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam saepe ac tam multipliciter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multiplicabilis: <entryFree id="n29919" type="hapax" key="multi^pli^ca_bi^li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭplĭcābĭlĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multiplico</etym>, <sense id="n29919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">manifold</hi>, a word formed by Cicero in translating a passage of Sophocles (Trach. 1046 sq.): tortu multiplicabili Draconem, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22 (Sophocles has only <foreign lang="greek">dra/konta</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
multiplicatio: <entryFree id="n29920" type="main" key="multi^pli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭplĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making manifold, increasing, multiplying</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n29920.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinariarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 34" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29920.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">multiplication</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multiplicator: <entryFree id="n29921" type="main" key="multi^pli^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭplĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a multiplier</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">herilium talentorum multiplicator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 44</bibl></cit>.—As math. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the multiplier</hi>, Boëth. de Music. 2, 27 al.</sense></entryFree>
multiplicitas: <entryFree id="n29922" type="main" key="multi^pli^ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭplĭcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>multiplex</etym>, <sense id="n29922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">multiplicity, manifoldness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profunda et infinita (sc. memoriae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:17" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 17 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; Boëth. de Music. 1, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Arithm. 1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Arithm. 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multipliciter: <entryFree id="n29923" type="main" key="multi^pli^ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭplĭcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. multiplex <sense id="n29923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
multiplico: <entryFree id="n29924" type="main" key="multi^pli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭplĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>multiplex</etym>, <sense id="n29924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to multiply, increase, augment</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29924.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.; syn.: augeo, amplifico, amplio): aes alienum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl>: auxiliis multiplicatis. Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina collectis multiplicantur aquis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplicandis usuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 23, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum Eumenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplicata gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus multiplicata,</quote> <trans><tr>enlarged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29924.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in arithmetic, <hi rend="ital">to multiply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplicantur in se duo latera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has duas summas in se multiplicato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudinis pedes cum longitudinis pedibus sic multiplicabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter tria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos quater, dies octies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multiplicus: <entryFree id="n29925" type="hapax" key="multi^pli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-plĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">variously compounded</hi> (for the class. multiplex): <cit><quote lang="la">quae multiplica ludens composuit (Laevius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multipotens: <entryFree id="n29926" type="main" key="multi^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multum-potens</etym>, <sense id="n29926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very powerful, very mighty</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">frater Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
multiradix: <entryFree id="n29927" type="main" key="multi^ra_dix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-rādix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-radix</etym>, <sense id="n29927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many - rooted, having many roots</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">centaurea minor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multiramis: <entryFree id="n29928" type="main" key="multi^ra_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-rāmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus - ramus</etym>, <sense id="n29928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">many-branched</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">thyrsus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multiscius: <entryFree id="n29929" type="main" key="multi^sci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-scĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multumscius</etym>, <sense id="n29929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowing much, of great knowledge</hi> (Appul.): <cit><quote lang="la">etsi minus prudentem, multiscium reddidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 223, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 294, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sophista longe multiscius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 4, p. 360, 12 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
multisonalis: <entryFree id="n29930" type="main" key="multi^so^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭsŏnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-sonus</etym>, <sense id="n29930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much-resounding</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multisonorus: <entryFree id="n29931" type="main" key="multi^so^no_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-sŏnōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multumsonorus</etym>, <sense id="n29931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loud-sounding</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">esseda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multisonus: <entryFree id="n29932" type="main" key="multi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-sonus</etym>,<cb n="MULT" />  <sense id="n29932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loud-sounding</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Atthis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:53:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 53, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multitius: <entryFree id="n29933" type="main" key="multi_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. multicius.</entryFree>
multitudo: <entryFree id="n29934" type="main" key="multi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>multus</etym>, <sense id="n29934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great number, multitude</hi> (class.; cf.: copia, vis, magnitudo). </sense><sense id="n29934.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes, quae numero hominum ac multitudine ipsā poterant in provincias nostras redundare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: argenti facti, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 465, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29934.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29934.3" n="A" level="2"> Of people, <hi rend="ital">a great number, a crowd, multitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta multitudo lapides ac tela conjiciebat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arist. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudine domum circumdare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudine civium factiones valuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima lux mediocrem multitudinem ante moenia ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur., multitudes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim exquirebant duces multitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29934.4" n="2" level="3"> Of the common people, <hi rend="ital">the crowd, the multitude</hi> (cf. turba): <cit><quote lang="la">ex errore imperitae multitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed multitudinem haec maxime allicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinis judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:29:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 29, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">credula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29934.5" n="B" level="2"> In gram.: numerus multitudinis, or simply multitudo, <hi rend="ital">the plural number, the plural</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod alia vocabula singularia sint solum ut cicer, alia multitudinis solum ut scalae ... multitudinis vocabula sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 63</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cur mel et vinum, atque id genus cetera numerum multitudinis capiunt, lacte non capiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 65</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
multivagus: <entryFree id="n29935" type="main" key="multi^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multumvagus</etym>, <sense id="n29935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that wanders about much</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 37, 52, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexus lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multividus: <entryFree id="n29936" type="main" key="multi^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-vĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multum-video</etym>, <sense id="n29936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">much-seeing</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, 27, § 109</bibl> Kopp.</sense></entryFree>
multivira: <entryFree id="n29937" type="main" key="multi^vi^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-vĭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>multus-vir</etym>, <sense id="n29937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that has had many husbands</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alia sacra coronat univira, alia multivira,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 24, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multivius: <entryFree id="n29938" type="main" key="multi^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-vĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multus-via</etym>, <sense id="n29938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having many ways, multivious</hi> (Appul.): <cit><quote lang="la">circuitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumcursio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 222 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (al. multijuga).</sense></entryFree>
multivolus: <entryFree id="n29939" type="main" key="multi^vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-vŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>multusvolo</etym>, <sense id="n29939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wishing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">longing for many</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
multivorantia: <entryFree id="n29940" type="main" key="multi^vo^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multĭ-vŏrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>multus-voro</etym>, <sense id="n29940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gluttony</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">multivorantiae pronus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
multo: <entryFree id="n29941" type="main" key="multo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. multus <sense id="n29941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29942" type="main" key="multo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">mulcto</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. multa</etym>, <sense id="n29942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to punish</hi> one with any thing; used mostly of judicial punishment (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">punio, animadverto): accusatorem multā et poenā multavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia hominum atque fraudes damnis, ignominiis, vinculis, verberibus, exsiliis, morte multantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatorem deminutione provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 38</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> of that with respect to which the punishment is inflicted: <cit><quote lang="la">populos stipendio,</quote> <trans><tr>to sentence them to pay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsules bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pecuniā,</quote> <trans><tr>to fine in a sum of money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochum Asiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publice armis multati privatis copiis juvere militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poculo multabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: aliquem votis (like damnare votis), lit., <hi rend="ital">to punish with his vows</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by granting the object of his vows</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 462, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ab ipsā fortunā videat hujus consilia esse multata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves iniquitate operis (al. mulcare),</quote> <trans><tr>to torment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <case>dat.</case> of the person for whose benefit: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri esse multatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 21</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 19</bibl>, Ritschl reads mulcaverit, but this seems to be corrupt; v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
multotiens: <entryFree id="n29943" type="main" key="multo^ti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multŏtĭens</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">multŏtĭes</orth>, <sense id="n29943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, [multus]. <hi rend="ital">many times, oftentimes, often</hi> (postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Nov 29 praef" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Nov 29 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
multum: <entryFree id="n29944" type="main" key="multum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. multus <sense id="n29944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
multus: <entryFree id="n29945" type="main" key="multus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">multus</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">moltus</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um; <sense id="n29945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> plus; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> plurimus (v. at the end of this art.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">much, great, many</hi>, of things corporeal and incorporeal. </sense><sense id="n29945.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29945.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: multi mortales, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: multi suam rem <pb n="1173" /> <cb n="MULT" /> bene gessere: multi qui, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl> (Trag. v. 295 sq. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">multi fortissimi viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 222</bibl></cit>. tam multis verbis scribere, <hi rend="ital">at such length</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia. Cato ap. Fest. s. v. ratissima, p. 286 Müll.: multi alii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—When used with another adjective it is usually connected with it by a conjunction: <cit><quote lang="la">multae et magnae contentiones,</quote> <trans><tr>many great conlests</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">O multas et graves offensiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi et graves dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:45:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 45, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi et varii timores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae bonaeque artes animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa et clara facinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 31</bibl></cit>.—But when the second adjective is used substantively the conjunction is omitted: <cit><quote lang="la">multi improbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi boni, docti, prudentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:20:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 20, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa acerba habuit ille annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">66, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa infanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa falsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 23, 2</bibl></cit>.—Also, when the second adjective forms with its substantive a single conception: <cit><quote lang="la">multa secunda proelia,</quote> <trans><tr>victories</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa libera capita,</quote> <trans><tr>freemen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 41, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae liberae civitates,</quote> <trans><tr>republics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:30:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 30, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos fortes viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 8, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi clari viri,</quote> <trans><tr>noblemen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi primarii viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:61:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 61, § 149</bibl></cit>.—Similarly, et is omitted between multi and adjectives which form with their substantives familiar phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">multi clarissimi viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi amplissimi viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 14, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 16, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi honestissimi homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi peritissimi homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi summi homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:26:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 26, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi clarissimi et sapientissimi viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 18, 43</bibl>.—Et is also omitted when the substantive stands between the two adjectives: <cit><quote lang="la">in veteribus patronis multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa praeterea bella gravia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis suppliciis justis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa majores nostri magna et gravia bella gesserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima signa pulcherrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:23:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 23, § 61</bibl></cit>.—When both adjectives follow the substantive, et is sometimes inserted: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes animi multae et magnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas ille multas et graves habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 30, 82</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and is sometimes omitted, the emphasis then falling on the second adjective: utebatur hominibus improbis, multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia multa, foeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—With a partitive <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 40, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae silvestrium arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 128</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">multa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">many things, much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:18:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 18, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae non ita multae,</quote> <trans><tr>not so many, not so very many</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 7, 7, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum multa scire,</quote> <trans><tr>too few</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: bene multi, <hi rend="ital">a good many</hi>, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam minime multa vestigia servitutis,</quote> <trans><tr>as few as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime multi remiges,</quote> <trans><tr>exceedingly few</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in multas pecunias alienissimorum hominum invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:19:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 19, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae pecuniae variis ex causis a privatis detinentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes multi stands for multi alii, <hi rend="ital">many others</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam certe Pompeio, et a Curionibus patre et filio, et a multis exprobratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl></cit>.—The <number>sing.</number> also is used <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the <hi rend="ital">plur., many a</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut trudit acres hinc et hinc multā cane Apros in obstantes plagas,</quote> <trans><tr>with many dogs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa prece prosequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā victima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: agna. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:772" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 772</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; so of persons: multus sua vulnera puppi Affixit moriens, <hi rend="ital">many a one</hi>, for multi affixerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 707</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, to denote quantity, <hi rend="ital">much, great, abundant</hi>: multum aurum et argentum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstructa mensa multā carne rancidā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo labore quaerere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>with much labor, great exertion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <trans><tr>much sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 81</bibl></cit>: sermo, <hi rend="ital">much conversalion</hi>, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 1</bibl>: stilus tuus multi sudoris est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 257</bibl>: multo cibo et potione completi, id. <cb n="MULT" /> Tusc. 5, 35, 100: <cit><quote lang="la">multo sanguine ea Poenis victoria stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum sanguinem haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:32" default="NO">8, 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam harenam mare evomit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae vestis injectu opprimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa et lauta supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multam salutem dicere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to greet heartily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum auro et argento multo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">Itaque multum diei processerat,</quote> <trans><tr>a great part of the day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad multum diem,</quote> <trans><tr>till far in the day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo adhuc die,</quote> <trans><tr>when much of the day was still remaining, when it was still high day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo denique die,</quote> <trans><tr>when the day was far spent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā nocte,</quote> <trans><tr>late at night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo mane,</quote> <trans><tr>very early</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa opinio, for multorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the general opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut multā pace,</quote> <trans><tr>as in a general peace, as if there were peace everywhere</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multus homo,</quote> <trans><tr>one who gives himself up to the lusts of many</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:112:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 112, 1</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">multi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the many, the common mass, the multitude</hi>: probis probatus potius, quam multis forem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 519, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">video ego te, mulier, more multarum utier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—Esp.: unus e (or de) multis, <hi rend="ital">one of the multitude, a man of no distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis L. Virginius unusque e multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus de multis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: M. Calidius non fuit orator unus e multis; <cit><quote lang="la">potius inter multos prope singularis fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerarer in multis,</quote> <trans><tr>among the herd of orators</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 97, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e multis una sit tibi,</quote> <trans><tr>no better than others</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is of importance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 272</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: ne multa, or ne multis, <hi rend="ital">not to be prolix, in short</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne multa: perquiritur a coactoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne multis: Diogenes emitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid multis moror?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes multa is used (particularly by the poets) adverbially, <hi rend="ital">much, greatly, very</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa reluctari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 226</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:869" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 869</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos testatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. nonnulla invehi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tim. 5, 3</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">haud multa moratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 610</bibl></cit>.—Rarely in multum: <cit><quote lang="la">in multum velociores,</quote> <trans><tr>by far</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 36, 52, § 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29945.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29945.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Too much, overmuch, excessive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex modica, non multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29945.5" n="2" level="3"> In speech, <hi rend="ital">much-speaking, diffuse, prolix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in aliquo genere aut inconcinnus aut multus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in re notā et pervulgatā multus et insolens sim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 87, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo in stellarum ratione multus vobis videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 119</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29945.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Frequent, frequently present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in operibus, in agmine, atque ad vigilias multus adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multus in eo proelio Caesar fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>was in many places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:50" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hen hercle hominem multum et odiosum mihi!</quote> <trans><tr>troublesome, tedious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n29945.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">multum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">much, very much, greatly, very, often, frequently, far</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">salve multum, gnate mi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum vale,</quote> <trans><tr>farewell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem ineptum multum et odiosum mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinor, Cassium uti non ita multum sorore,</quote> <trans><tr>not very much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum mecum municipales homines loquuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>often</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum ille quidem nec saepe dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum confidere,</quote> <trans><tr>not very much, not particularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt in venationibus,</quote> <trans><tr>often, frequently</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eodem genere causarum multum erat T. Juventius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum fuisse cum aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to have had much intercourse with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum multum equidem cum Phaedro in Epicuri hortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiā valere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be in great favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res multum et saepe quaesita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe omnes multumque superabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum et diu cogitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu multumque scriptitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:152"
